elaboratio: <entryFree id="n15372" type="hapax" key="e_la^bo_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlăbōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>elaboro</etym>, <sense id="n15372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">persevering labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careful diligence</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 22, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elaboratus: <entryFree id="n15373" type="hapax" key="e_la^bo_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlăbōrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">persevering labor</hi>, only in <case>abl.</case>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 346</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elaboro: <entryFree id="n15374" type="main" key="e_la^bo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lăbōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n15374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15374.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endeavor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exert one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take pains</hi> either successfully or perseveringly = eniti (class.; most freq. in Cic.).— Constr. with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in aliqua re</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi>, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15374.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">enitere, elabora, vel potius eblandire, effice, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit> C, § 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 72 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 5:18" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 5, 18</bibl> (twice); and <hi rend="ital">pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperte elaboratur, ut verba verbis respondeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 12, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15374.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In aliqua re</hi> (so in Cic. most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">elaborant (senes) in iis, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 7, 24</bibl></cit> Gernh.; 8, 26; 11, 38; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:119" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 119</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">pass. impers.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 29</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Also in eo (iis), ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15374.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In aliquid</hi> (very seldom): <cit><quote lang="la">ei non in unam partem aliquam, sed in omnia elaborandum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">totis mentibus huc tendamus, in hoc elaboremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 31</bibl></cit>, v. Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> —* </sense><sense id="n15374.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">(declamatores) breviores commentarios facere elaborarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 58</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 6:24" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 6, 24</bibl>; so Dom. Afer. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 14, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15374.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to labor on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take pains with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to work out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elaborate</hi> (so for the most part only in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, and esp. freq. since the Aug. period): <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid elaborari aut effici potuerit ad istorum benevolentiam conciliandam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ingenio quoque, sicut in agro, quamquam diu serantur atque elaborentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Graecis elaborata dicendi vis atque copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:7:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae diligenter elaboratae et tamquam elucubratae,</quote> <trans><tr>carefully elaborated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 90</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 19, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:12" default="NO">8, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:12 al" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 14, 12 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elaboratum a parentibus imperium,</quote> <trans><tr>acquired by the labors of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">candelabrorum superficiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 3, 6, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non Siculae dapes Dulcem elaborabunt saporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15374.7" n="B" level="2"> In rhet.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlăbōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, sometimes with the accessory notion of overdoing, <hi rend="ital">elaborate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elaborata concinnitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 25, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil arcessiti et elaborati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elacatenes: <entryFree id="n15375" type="greek" key="e_la^ca^te_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlăcătēnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h)lakath=nes</foreign>, <sense id="n15375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large sea-fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tunny</hi>, so called from its resemblance in shape to a spindle, <foreign lang="greek">h)laka/th</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl> (dub.; Jan. and Sillig ictinus, iulis).—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlăcătae</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 12</bibl>. Here belongs elacatena genus salsamenti, quod appellatur vulgo melandrea, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=76:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 76, 15</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
elaea: <entryFree id="n15376" type="main" key="E^laea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)elai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n15376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Aeolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:43 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 43 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
elaeemporia: <entryFree id="n15377" type="greek" key="e^laeempo^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlaeempŏrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)laiempori/a</foreign>, <sense id="n15377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">traffic in oil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the oil-trade</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18:section=19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 18, § 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elaeogarum: <entryFree id="n15378" type="main" key="e^laeo^ga^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlaeŏgărum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n15378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish-sauce with oil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elaeomeli: <entryFree id="n15379" type="greek" key="e^laeo^me^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlaeŏmĕli</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)laio/meli</foreign>, <sense id="n15379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of manna which exudes from the branches of the olive-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:96" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 4, 50, § 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elaeon: <entryFree id="n15380" type="greek" key="e^laeo_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlaeōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)laiw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n15380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plantation of olives</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
elaeothesium: <entryFree id="n15381" type="greek" key="e^laeo^the^si^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlaeŏthĕsĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)laioqe/sion</foreign>, <sense id="n15381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the anointing-room in a bath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 11, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elaeus: <entryFree id="n15382" type="main" key="E^laeu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlaeūs</orth>, <itype>ūntis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)elaiou=s</foreign>, <sense id="n15382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city on the Hellespont in the Thracian Chersonesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 16, 5</bibl> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 49</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Elēüs</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elagabalus: <entryFree id="n15383" type="main" key="Elagabalus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Elagabalus</orth>, v. Heliogabalus.</entryFree>
elambo: <entryFree id="n15384" type="main" key="e_lambo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lambo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lick away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove<pb n="636" /> <cb n="ELAV" />  by licking</hi>: mox ut elambente matris lingua detersa sint (animalia), Mar. Vict. Art. Metr. 4, 2, 5.</sense></entryFree>
elamentabilis: <entryFree id="n15385" type="hapax" key="e_la_menta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lāmentābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n15385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very lamentable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 57</bibl></cit> Mos. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
elanguesco: <entryFree id="n15386" type="main" key="e_languesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-languesco</orth>, <itype>gui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n15386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow faint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to slacken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relax</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut elanguescendum aliena ignavia esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46, 7</bibl></cit>; so in the <hi rend="ital">praes.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:111" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 111 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:140 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 140 al.</bibl>—In the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elanguimus, patres conscripti, nec jam ille senatus sumus qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">differendo deinde elanguit res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 26, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tamen elanguit cura hominum eā morā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 23, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:3:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:572" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 572</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elanguidus: <entryFree id="n15387" type="main" key="e_langui^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlanguĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ex + languidus</etym>, <sense id="n15387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">utterly weary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fortun.</author> Vit. Martin. 1, 296</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elaphoboscon: <entryFree id="n15388" type="greek" key="e^la^pho^boscon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlăphŏboscon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)lafobo/skon</foreign> (deer-food), <sense id="n15388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wild parsnips</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 37, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elapidatus: <entryFree id="n15389" type="main" key="e_la^pi^da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lăpĭdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [lapido], <sense id="n15389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cleared from stones</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:69" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 10, 14, § 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:145" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 16, 43, § 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elapsus: <entryFree id="n15390" type="main" key="e_lapsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlapsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from elabor.</entryFree>
elaqueo: <entryFree id="n15391" type="main" key="e_la^que^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lăquĕo</orth>, no <sense id="n15391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to extricate from snares</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fetters; to disentangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfetter</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n15391.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15391.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a vinculo angoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constantiam animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 147</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elargior: <entryFree id="n15392" type="main" key="e_largi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-largĭor</orth>, <itype>īri</itype>, <sense id="n15392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae carisque propinquis quantum elargiri deceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:71" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 71</bibl></cit>; Jul. Firm. Math. 3, 10.</sense></entryFree>
elassesco: <entryFree id="n15393" type="hapax" key="e_lassesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lassesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n15393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become exhausted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weary.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia germinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 41, § 98</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elate: <entryFree id="n15394" type="main" key="e_la_te1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlāte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n15394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loftily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proudly;</hi> v. 1. effero, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15395" type="greek" key="e^la^te2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlăte</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)la/th</foreign>, <sense id="n15395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of firtree</hi>, Lat. abies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 28, 62, § 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:99" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 5, 53, § 99</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15395.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The envelope</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leaf of the palm-bud</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 5, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elatea: <entryFree id="n15396" type="main" key="E^la^te_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlătēa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ela/teia</foreign>. <sense id="n15396.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Phocis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 9 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15396.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elateius: <entryFree id="n15397" type="main" key="E^la^te_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlătēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n15397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Elatus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prince of the Lapithae</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caeneus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>his son</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 497</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles, the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:189" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 189</bibl></cit>; v. Caeneus.</sense></entryFree>
elaterium: <entryFree id="n15398" type="greek" key="e^la^te_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlătērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)lath/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n15398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicine prepared from the juice of the wild cucumber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 5</bibl>; Scribon. Comp. 70, 224; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 1, 3, § 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
elatine: <entryFree id="n15399" type="greek" key="e^la^ti_ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlătīne</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)lati/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n15399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant of the genus</hi> Antirrhinum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 50, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elatio: <entryFree id="n15400" type="main" key="e_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. effero</etym>, <sense id="n15400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15400.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-class.): FERRI, Inscr. Fratr. Arval. ap. Marin. 43 and 402.—</sense><sense id="n15400.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n15400.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A carrying to the grave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a burial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:14:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 14, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15400.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A lifting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">raising up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">onerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>high waves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:92:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 92, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n15400.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (class.). </sense><sense id="n15400.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A being carried away</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hurried along; transport</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia quasi gestientis animi elatio voluptaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf.: efferri laetitiā, under effero, II. B.).—</sense><sense id="n15400.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Exaltation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elatio et magnitudo animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">elatio atque altitudo orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 17, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parium autem comparatio nec elationem habet nec submissionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 18, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15400.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Self-exaltation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elation</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">superbia, insolentia, arrogantia, vanitas, fastus, fastidium),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Psa. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; Serm. 17, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 5, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elatites: <entryFree id="n15401" type="greek" key="e^la^ti_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlătītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)lati/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n15401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of blood-stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 20, 38, § 147</bibl> (dub. Jan. miltiten).</sense></entryFree>
elatro: <entryFree id="n15402" type="main" key="e_la_tro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lātro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bark out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cry aloud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid acriter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elatus: <entryFree id="n15403" type="main" key="e_la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from effero, <sense id="n15403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exalted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high.</hi></sense></entryFree>
elaudare: <entryFree id="n15404" type="gloss" key="e_lauda_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlaudāre</orth> <itype>plus quam nominare</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=76:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 76, 4</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
elautus: <entryFree id="n15405" type="main" key="e_lautus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlautus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from elavo.</entryFree>
elaver: <entryFree id="n15406" type="main" key="E^la^ver"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlăver</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n15406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Gaul emptying into the Liger</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Allier</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">53</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="ELEC" /></sense></entryFree>
elavo: <entryFree id="n15407" type="main" key="e_la^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lăvo</orth>, <itype>lāvi, lautum, lōtum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wash out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wash clean</hi> (very rare; not in the Cic. per.). </sense><sense id="n15407.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">elota cerussa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 3: <cit><quote lang="la">elota oliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15407.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">elautae ambae sumus opera Neptunia,</quote> <trans><tr>washed in the sea</tr>, <tr>wrecked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 37</bibl></cit>; so, in mari elavare, <hi rend="ital">to wash</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bathe in the sea</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be shipwrecked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruined</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 21</bibl>; 5, 2, 20.— Hence, trop.: nos mare acerrumum: nam in mari repperi, hic elavi bonis, <hi rend="ital">have lost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">been stripped of</hi> property, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 2, 9</bibl> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 7</bibl>, the true reading is elutum, Ritschl, Brix).</sense></entryFree>
elea: <entryFree id="n15408" type="main" key="E^le^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ele/a</foreign>, <sense id="n15408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Lucania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birth-place of Parmenides and Zeno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the founders of the Eleatic philosophy</hi>, in Lat. also called Velia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 82</bibl>.— Hence, Zeno <orth extent="full" lang="la">Elĕātes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">of Elea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 52</bibl>; and: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Elĕātĭci</orth> <itype>philosophi</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Eleatic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elecebra: <entryFree id="n15409" type="main" key="e_le^ce^bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlĕcĕbra</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">exlec-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>elicio</etym>, <sense id="n15409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female allurer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheedler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sponger</hi> (a Plautin. word), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 20</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=76:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 76, 5</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
electarium: <entryFree id="n15410" type="main" key="e_lecta_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlectārĭum</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlectuārium</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ecligma</etym>, <sense id="n15410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicament that melts in the mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an electuary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:169:176 al" default="NO">169, 176 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 4, 9, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
electe: <entryFree id="n15411" type="main" key="e_lecte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlecte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n15411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">choicely</hi>, v. <itype>eligo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></sense></entryFree>
electilis: <entryFree id="n15412" type="main" key="e_lecti^li^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlectĭlĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>eligo</etym>, <sense id="n15412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">choice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dainty</hi> (with probus): <cit><quote lang="la">piscatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 245, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
electio: <entryFree id="n15413" type="main" key="e_lecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a choice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">selection</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:20:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 20, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl>; Prooem. § 2; 3, 4, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:72" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 72 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 23 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiatarum electiones,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the option given to a violated maiden</tr>, <tr>whether her ravisher shall be put to death or shall marry her</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 35</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of <hi rend="ital">the election</hi> of believers to the divine favor (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 9, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,013:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Thess. 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
electo: <entryFree id="n15414" type="main" key="e_lecto1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>elicio</etym>, <sense id="n15414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to get out artfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worm out</hi> a secret (a Plautin. word), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 111</bibl>; cf.: electabo, eliciam, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=76:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 76, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15415" type="hapax" key="e_lecto2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>eligo</etym>, <sense id="n15415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to choose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">select</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elector: <entryFree id="n15416" type="hapax" key="e_lector1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chooser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">selecter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15417" type="greek" key="e_lector2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlector</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h)le/ktwr</foreign>, <sense id="n15417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the shining sun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 24, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
electra: <entryFree id="n15418" type="main" key="E_lectra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlectra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<case>nom.</case> with long <sense id="n15418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14, 5</bibl> (3, 6, 5 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:177" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 36</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Electrān,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:395" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 395</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">174</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)hle/ktra</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n15418.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Atlas and Pleione</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the seven Pleiades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Dardanus by Jupiter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:31 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 31 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 135</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ib. 7, 207</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 155" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 155</bibl> and 192. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlectrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Samothrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:431" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 431</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15418.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Agamemnon and Clytemnestra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and sister of Orestes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14, 5</bibl> (3, 6, 5 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:218" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 218</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 117" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:122" default="NO">122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 471</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">the name of a tragedy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:395" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 395</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15418.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Danaïd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 170" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 170</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15418.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Oceanid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Thaumas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of the Harpies</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 212</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">241</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
electreus: <entryFree id="n15419" type="hapax" key="e_lectre^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlectrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>electrum</etym>, <sense id="n15419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of amber</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
electrifer: <entryFree id="n15420" type="hapax" key="e_lectri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlectrĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>electrumfero</etym>, <sense id="n15420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">producing amber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in amber</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Fescenn. 12, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
electrinus: <entryFree id="n15421" type="main" key="e_lectri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlectrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>electrum</etym>, <sense id="n15421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of amber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made of amber</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">patera, Treb. Poll. XXX. Tyr. 13: vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:32:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 32, § 5</bibl></cit>: anuli, Marc. Empir. 8.</sense></entryFree>
electrius: <entryFree id="n15422" type="main" key="E_lectri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlectrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Electra, I.</entryFree>
electrix: <entryFree id="n15423" type="main" key="e_lectrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlectrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>elector</etym>, <sense id="n15423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that selects</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chooses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 8, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
electrum: <entryFree id="n15424" type="greek" key="e_lectrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlectrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h)/lektron</foreign>. <sense id="n15424.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Amber</hi> (pure Lat. succinum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 316</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 54</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n15424.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an amber ball</hi>, carried by Roman ladies in their hands to keep them cool.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 365</bibl>; cf. Böttig. Sabina, II. p. 210.—</sense><sense id="n15424.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mixed metal</hi> (natural or artificial) <hi rend="ital">resembling amber in color</hi>, <cb n="ELEG" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:81 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 23, § 81 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 24, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 402</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">624</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:229" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 229</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15424.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an article made of amber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:51" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:307" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 307</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
electrus: <entryFree id="n15425" type="main" key="e_lectrus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlectrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>electrum</etym>, <sense id="n15425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of amber</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 25, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15426" type="main" key="E_lectrus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlectrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Perseus and father of Alcmena</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 99</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Electryon</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 244" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 244</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
electuarium: <entryFree id="n15427" type="main" key="e_lectu^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlectŭārĭum</orth>, v. electarium.</entryFree>
electus: <entryFree id="n15428" type="main" key="e_lectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">choice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent;</hi> v. eligo.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15429" type="hapax" key="e_lectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>eligo</etym>, <sense id="n15429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a choice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">necis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 144</bibl></cit> Loers. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
eleemosyna: <entryFree id="n15430" type="greek" key="e^le^e_mo^sy^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕēmŏsyna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)lehmosu/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n15430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">alms</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Patient. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 21:27" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 21, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:6:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 6, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
elegans: <entryFree id="n15431" type="main" key="e_le^gans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlĕgans</orth> (in some MSS. eligans; cf. Beier <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Orr. Fragmm. p. 105</bibl>), <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prob. collat. form of eligens, from eligo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 72</bibl></etym>. <sense id="n15431.0" n="I" level="1"> In the ante-class. period in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">luxurious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fastidious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nice</hi>: elegans homo non dicebatur cum laude; <cit><quote lang="la">sed id fere verbum ad aetatem M. Catonis vitii, non laudis fuit ... ex quibus verbis (Catonis) apparet, elegantem dictum antiquitus non ab ingenii elegantia, sed qui nimis lecto amoenoque cultu victuque esset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 465, 11 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heia, ut elegans est!</quote> <trans><tr>how choice! how nice!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 19</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 18</bibl> (but not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 14</bibl>, v. Ritschl ad h. l.).—</sense><sense id="n15431.1" n="II" level="1"> Class. in a good sense, <hi rend="ital">choice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tasteful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegant.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15431.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: tu festivus, tu elegans, tu solus urbanus, quem decet muliebris ornatus, etc., Cic. Clod. et Cur. 5, p. 105, ed. Beier; cf. (with mundus) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 23</bibl>; (with splendidus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and opp. parcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:40:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 40, 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 25, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:13" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier (Phryne—with formosa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intelligo te hominem in omni judicio elegantissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">68, 239</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:78 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 78 al.</bibl>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: quis verbis aut ornatior aut elegantior (sc. Caesare)? Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 55</bibl>; in the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elegans et concinnus (pictor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 111</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlĕgantes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">fine gentlemen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">city people</hi> (opp. agrestes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15431.3" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">nec magis compositum quicquam, nec magis elegans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. (with decorum) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a necessariis artificiis ad elegantiora defluximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes elegantes et ingenuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 8, 8, § 34</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicitis, hoc genus (jocandi) quam sit facetum, quam elegans, quam oratorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 241</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:65 al" default="NO">10, 1, 65 al.</bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego autem a te elegantiora desidero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 13</bibl></cit> a.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta Terentii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:99" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 99</bibl></cit>: utrum sit elegantius, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 50</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlĕganter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with correct choice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tastefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gracefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lautiores eleganter accepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiete et pure atque eleganter acta aetas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">acta vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba foliis rotundis eleganter vestita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 19, § 43</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">psallere et saltare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim facere potuit elegantius ad hominum existimationem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elegantius aut justius fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facturos si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem elegantius loca cepisse,</quote> <trans><tr>more fitly</tr>, <tr>judiciously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam accurate eleganterque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 22, 86</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of speech,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:102" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:21 al" default="NO">8, 2, 21 al.</bibl>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:72:252" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 72, 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eleganter: <entryFree id="n15432" type="main" key="e_le^ganter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlĕganter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. preced. <sense id="n15432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
elegantia: <entryFree id="n15433" type="main" key="e_le^gantia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlĕgantia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>elegans</etym>. * <sense id="n15433.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A being nice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">particular; exquisiteness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fastidiousness</hi> (ante-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ejus elegantia meam extemplo speciem spernat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 20</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n15433.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propriety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refinement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegance</hi> (cf.: gustus, sapor, judicium). </sense><sense id="n15433.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: tu eloquentiam ab elegantia doctrinae segregandam putes, Cic. de Or. <pb n="637" /> <cb n="ELEM" /> 1, 2, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli (with venustas oris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac subtilitas operum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 15, 26, § 66</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum Latinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:261" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 75, 261</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">scriptorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Latini sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mira sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:114" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and transf.: Socraticorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Secundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 11</bibl></cit>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocum verborumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n15433.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua munditia homines! qua elegantia!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:28:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 28, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (agricultura) abhorret ab omni politiore elegantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 9, 18, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:71" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 6, 8, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elegantia modo et munditia remanebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:19 al" default="NO">10, 2, 19 al.</bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudatus propter elegantias dominus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 34, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elegatus: <entryFree id="n15434" type="hapax" key="e^le^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕgātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown kind of fish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 4, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elegi: <entryFree id="n15435" type="greek" key="e^le^gi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕgi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/legoi</foreign>, <sense id="n15435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">elegiac verses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an elegy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 135; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 10 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
elegia: <entryFree id="n15436" type="greek" key="e^le^gi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕgīa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕgēa</orth>, in Ov. <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕgēĭă</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)legei/a</foreign>. <sense id="n15436.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An elegy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">form elegia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:93" default="NO">93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:30:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 30, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 7, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form elegea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">form elegeia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 379</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15436.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of reed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est et obliqua harundo, non in excelsitatem nascens, sed juxta terram fruticis modo se spargens, suavissima in teneritate animalibus: vocatur a quibusdam elegia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 167</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elegiacus: <entryFree id="n15437" type="greek" key="e^le^gi_^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕgī^ăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)legiako/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">elegiac</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 507</bibl></cit> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> p. 1824</bibl> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elegidarion: <entryFree id="n15438" type="hapax" key="e^le^gi_da_ri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕgīdārĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>elegidion</etym>, <sense id="n15438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short elegy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 109, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elegidion: <entryFree id="n15439" type="greek" key="e^le^gi_di^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕgīdĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)legei/dion</foreign>, <sense id="n15439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short elegy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:51" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elegion: <entryFree id="n15440" type="greek" key="e^le^gi_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕgīon</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕgēon</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)legei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n15440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an elegiac poem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an elegy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 94, 2</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Parent. 29, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elego: <entryFree id="n15441" type="main" key="e_le_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lēgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to convey away</hi> (from the family) <hi rend="ital">by bequest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bequeath away</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 43, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:215" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 215</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elegus: <entryFree id="n15442" type="greek" key="e^le^gus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/legos</foreign>, <sense id="n15442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">elegiac</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 502</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n15443" type="main" key="e^le^gus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. elegi.</entryFree>
eleis: <entryFree id="n15444" type="main" key="E_le_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlēïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Elis, II. C.</entryFree>
eleleus: <entryFree id="n15445" type="greek" key="E^le^leus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlĕleus</orth>, <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)eleleu/s</foreign> [from <foreign lang="greek">e)leleu=</foreign>, the cry of the Bacchantes], <sense id="n15445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Bacchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 15</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlĕlēĭdes</orth> = Bacchae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elelisphacos: <entryFree id="n15446" type="greek" key="e^le^lispha^cos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕlisphăcos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)leli/sfakos</foreign>, <sense id="n15446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 71, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:120" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 10, 73, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:150" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 15, 89, § 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elementarius: <entryFree id="n15447" type="main" key="e^le^menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>elementum, II.</etym>, <sense id="n15447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to the elements</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rudiments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elementary</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <trans><tr>an old schoolmaster</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 36" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <trans><tr>elementary knowledge</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elementicius: <entryFree id="n15448" type="hapax" key="e^le^menti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕmentīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">elementary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elemental</hi>: substantiae, Tert. de Anima, 32.</sense></entryFree>
elementum: <entryFree id="n15449" type="main" key="e^le^mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root al-, <hi rend="ital">to nourish;</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/n-al-tos, a)/lsos</foreign>; Lat. alo, alimentum, etc.; cf. Sanscr. al-akā, <hi rend="ital">a girl</hi></etym>, <sense id="n15449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a first principle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">element</hi> (cf.: initium, principium, exordium, primordium); Gr. <foreign lang="greek">stoixei=on</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n15449.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec de elementis video dubitari quatuor esse ea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 5, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:827" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 827</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:913" default="NO" valid="yes">913</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:393" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 393</bibl> et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:12 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 12 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:31" default="NO">3, 8, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 237</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl> Pet. 3, 10.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 69, 88, § 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:119" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 36, 42, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 1, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:86" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia ignis inviolabile sit elementum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 9 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15449.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15449.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The alphabet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 538</bibl> P.).—More freq., </sense><sense id="n15449.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the first principles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudiments</hi>, in the arts and sciences (cf. doctrina, praecepta). </sense><sense id="n15449.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">puerorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 163</bibl></cit>; cf. Quint. prooem. § 21; 1, 1, 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 17</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">loquendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 11, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 719</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15449.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n15449.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The ten categories</hi> of Aristotle, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:23 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 23 sq.</bibl> Spald.—* </sense><sense id="n15449.8" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">elementary scholars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beginners</hi>: vix <cb n="ELEU" /> se prima elementa ad spem effingendae eloquentiae audebunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15449.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The beginnings</hi> of other things: <cit><quote lang="la">prima Romae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:179" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:709" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidinis pravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">irarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:77" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:123 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 123 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
elenchus: <entryFree id="n15450" type="greek" key="e^lenchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlenchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/legxos</foreign>. <sense id="n15450.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A costly trinket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ear-pendant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:459" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 459</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:32:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 32, § 8</bibl>; cf. Boettig. Sabina II. p. 56.—</sense><sense id="n15450.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part of the title of a work of</hi> M. Pompilius Andronicus: adeo inops ut coactus est praecipuum illud opusculum suum, annalium Ennii elenchorum XVI. milibus nummum vendere, etc., prob. <hi rend="ital">a review</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refutation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elentesco: <entryFree id="n15451" type="main" key="e_lentesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lentesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n15451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [lenteo], <hi rend="ital">to become clammy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">soft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elephans: <entryFree id="n15452" type="main" key="e^le^phans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕphans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, v. elephas.</entryFree>
elephantia: <entryFree id="n15453" type="main" key="e^le^phanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕphantĭa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕphantĭăcus</orth>, v. elephantiasis.</entryFree>
elephantiasis: <entryFree id="n15454" type="greek" key="e^le^phanti^a^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕphantĭăsis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭōsis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> A. V. 4, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> de Gen. ad Lit. 9, 10</bibl>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)lefanti/asis</foreign>, <sense id="n15454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very virulent kind of leprosy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elephantiasis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:7 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 1, 5, § 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:109" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 10, 42, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:144" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 14, 52, § 144</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> A. V. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 4</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 25</bibl>, written as Greek). Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕphas</orth>, q. v., and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕphantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 250" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 250</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕphantĭcus</orth> <itype>morbus</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 4, 8, 12</bibl>. <hi rend="ital">One who labors under it</hi> is called <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕphantĭăcus</orth>, Firm. Math. 8, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ezech. 6, 18, 6</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕphantĭ-cus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 28</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕphantĭōsus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> de Gen. ad Lit. 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 84, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elephanticus: <entryFree id="n15455" type="main" key="elephanticus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">elephanticus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. preced. art. <sense id="n15455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
elephantine: <entryFree id="n15456" type="main" key="E^le^phanti_ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlĕphantīne</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)elefanti/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n15456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small but very fertile island of the Nile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the Thebaid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a city of the same name</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Jezyret-Assuan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:9" default="NO">9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 163</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Elĕphantis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elephantinus: <entryFree id="n15457" type="greek" key="e^le^phanti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕphantĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>elephas</etym>. <sense id="n15457.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Belonging to the elephant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15457.1" n="II" level="1"> = <foreign lang="greek">e)lefa/ntinos</foreign>, pure Lat. eburnĕus, <hi rend="ital">of ivory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber,</quote> <trans><tr>consisting of ivory tablets</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Tacit. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atramentum,</quote> <trans><tr>ivoryblack</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 25, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositio (emplastri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:19:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 19, 24</bibl></cit> Daremb.</sense></entryFree>
elephantiosis: <entryFree id="n15458" type="main" key="e^le^phanti^o_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕphantĭōsis</orth>, v. elephantiasis <sense id="n15458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
elephantis: <entryFree id="n15459" type="main" key="E^le^phantis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlĕphantis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype> (Gr. <sense id="n15459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> ĭdos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:43:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 43, 4</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)elefanti/s</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n15459.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island of the Nile</hi>, v.
