Elephantine.—</sense><sense id="n15459.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a licentious Greek poetess</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:43:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 43, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 24, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elephantus: <entryFree id="n15460" type="main" key="e^le^phantus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕphantus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕphās</orth>, <itype>antis</itype> (rarely <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕlĕphans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 1, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 196</bibl>; of the second form the <sense id="n15460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi>, and of the first the oblique cases are most freq.), <gen>m.</gen> (<hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 14</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">e)le/fas</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an elephant.</hi>—Form <hi rend="ital">elephantus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 47</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 9, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 19, 22, § 66</bibl> et saep. Its tough hide suggests the expression: <cit><quote lang="la">elephanti corio circumtentus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>thickheaded</tr>, <tr>stupid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 80</bibl></cit>.—Form <hi rend="ital">elephas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 17:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 208</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:732" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 732</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> elephantem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:41" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 41</bibl>; Gr. <case>acc.</case> elephanta, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 706</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 19:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 19, 4</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> elephantas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 667</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">740</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15460.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)le/fas</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n15460.2" n="A" level="2"> Form <hi rend="ital">elephantus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ivory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 464</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 896</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15460.3" n="B" level="2"> Form <hi rend="ital">elephas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the elephantiasis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1114</bibl>; Seren. Samm. 10.—</sense><sense id="n15460.4" n="C" level="2"> Form <hi rend="ital">elephantus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sea-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 5, 4, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:144" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:148" default="NO" valid="yes">148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eleus: <entryFree id="n15461" type="main" key="E_le_us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Elis, II. A.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n15462" type="main" key="E^le^u_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlĕūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Elaeus.</entryFree>
eleusin: <entryFree id="n15463" type="main" key="E^leusin"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕleusin</orth>, <itype>īnis</itype> (<case>acc.</case> Eleusin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:7:44" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 7, 44</bibl>; Lat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Eleusina</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Ver. 1, p. 178" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Ver. 1, p. 178</bibl>; Cl. Mam. <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Act. Jul. 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 1, 7</bibl>; and acc. to MSS. Eleusinam in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:42:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 42, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 25, 2</bibl>; cf. Salaminam from Salamis, q. v.), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)eleusi/n</foreign>, <sense id="n15463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient city of Attica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for its mysteries of Ceres</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lepsina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:42:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 42, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:507" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 507</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 439</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:382" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 382</bibl> <cb n="ELIC" /> al.—</sense><sense id="n15463.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n15463.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕleusīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Eleusinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ceres</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 163</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Eleusina Ceres et Proserpina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 99</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15463.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕleusī-nĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)eleusi/nios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Eleusinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:6:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 6, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Eleusinium certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:20:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕleusīnĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of Ceres at Eleusin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Val. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eleusium: <entryFree id="n15464" type="main" key="Eleusi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eleusĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n15464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 5, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eleuthericadurci: <entryFree id="n15465" type="main" key="Eleutheri Cadurci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Eleutheri Cadurci</orth>, v. Cadurci.</entryFree>
eleutheria: <entryFree id="n15466" type="greek" key="e^leuthe^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕleuthĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)leuqeri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n15466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">liberty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eleutherius: <entryFree id="n15467" type="greek" key="E^leuthe^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕleuthĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)eleuqe/rios</foreign> (Liberator), <sense id="n15467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the surname of a god</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 207</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕleuthĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of Jupiter Eleutherius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feast of liberty</hi>, celebrated in honor of the victory at Plataea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eleutherocilices: <entryFree id="n15468" type="main" key="E^leuthe^ro^ci^li^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕleuthĕrŏcĭlĭces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (free Cilicians), <sense id="n15468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people</hi> (probably <hi rend="ital">the aborigines</hi>) <hi rend="ital">in the mountains of Cilicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elevatio: <entryFree id="n15469" type="main" key="e_le^va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlĕvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>elevo</etym>. <sense id="n15469.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lifting up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raising</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">manuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:140:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 140, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n15469.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15469.2" n="1" level="3"> Gram. t. t., <hi rend="ital">the elevation</hi>: vocis (= <foreign lang="greek">a)/rsis</foreign>, opp. depositio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 974</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 1, 16, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15469.3" n="2" level="3"> Rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a lessening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disparaging;</hi> a species of irony, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 525</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elevator: <entryFree id="n15470" type="main" key="e_le^va_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlĕvātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who raises up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a deliverer</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">meus (deus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 22, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elevo: <entryFree id="n15471" type="main" key="e_le^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lĕvo</orth>, no <sense id="n15471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n15471.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lift up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">contabulationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit> and 7: <cit><quote lang="la">lumbos in altum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 7, 17</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">elevat hunc pluma,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>turns into a bird</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Eutr. 1, 295</bibl></cit>: aura preces, i. e. <hi rend="ital">carry away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disperse</hi>, = auferat, dissipet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructum,</quote> <trans><tr>to gather in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: statura elevata, i. e. <hi rend="ital">tall</hi>, Capit. Ant. Phil. 13.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n15471.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15471.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alleviate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegritudinem (with obtundere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:16:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 16, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. sollicitudines (opp. duplicare), Luccei. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 2</bibl>.—Esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n15471.4" n="B" level="2"> (In allusion to the rising of the lighter scale.) <hi rend="ital">To make light of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lessen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaken; to disparage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detract from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas suspicionum offensionumque tum evitare, tum elevare, tum ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">objectum ab adversario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:75 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 75 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:176" default="NO">11, 3, 176</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicuitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:57" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 57</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res gestas (opp. verbis extollere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxam multitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non si quid turbida Roma Elevet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—With personal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">est plane oratoris movere risum, quod frangit adversarium, quod impedit, quod elevat, quod deterret, quod refutat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 236</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">elevabatur index indiciumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samnitium bella extollit, elevat Etruscos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduos viros (copia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:33:44" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 33, 44</bibl></cit> (3, 31, 44 M.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 34, 58</bibl> (3, 32, 58 M.).—</sense><sense id="n15471.5" n="C" level="2"> Of the voice, <hi rend="ital">to lift up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 2, 4 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
elias: <entryFree id="n15472" type="main" key="E_li^as1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, v. Elis, II. D.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15473" type="main" key="E_li_a_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlīās</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Helias</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Elia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Elijah</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prophet of the Jews</hi>: form <hi rend="ital">Elias</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 11, 6</bibl>; form <hi rend="ital">Elia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elices: <entryFree id="n15474" type="main" key="e_li^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlĭces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>e-liquor; cf. colliciae</etym>, <sense id="n15474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trench for drawing off water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a drain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:82" default="NO">11, 2, 82</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=76:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 76, 2</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 109</bibl>; v. also elix.</sense></entryFree>
elicio: <entryFree id="n15475" type="main" key="e_li^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>lĭcŭi and lexi</itype> (elicuit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:100:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 100, 2</bibl>: <sense id="n15475.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">elexisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 154</bibl></cit>), lĭcìtum (<hi rend="ital">part.</hi> elicitus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:414" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 414</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:932" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 932</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:104:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 104, 4</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lacio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entice out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lure forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to elicit</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n15475.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15475.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem hinc foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem ex paludibus silvisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes citra flumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes in suum locum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 50, 3</bibl></cit>: aliquem ad pugnam. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 38</bibl>. <pb n="638" /> <cb n="ELIG" /> 1; 3, 85, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 62</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem praemiis ex civitatibus sociorum ad subeunda pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vatem ad colloquium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">premere ubera ad eliciendum lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:30:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 30, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15475.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in relig. lang.: Jovem, Manes, etc., <hi rend="ital">to call forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call down</hi> a god by religious rites; <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conjure up</hi> a departed spirit by magic arts, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:327" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 327</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:46" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:414" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 414</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 733</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:28 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 28 al.</bibl>—In a like sense: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina,</quote> <trans><tr>to call down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 3, § 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15475.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra elicit herbescentem ex eo (sc. semine) viriditatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <trans><tr>to utter</tr>, <tr>speak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 58</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 57</bibl>, the better reading is eicere voces): <cit><quote lang="la">voces et querelas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:80:278" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 80, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum ex eo de via ac ratione dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arcana ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 23</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, veritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas praesensionum,</quote> <trans><tr>to elicit</tr>, <tr>ascertain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 58</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cupidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 33</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum e terrae cavernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem lapidum conflictu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: sanguinem, id. poët. Tusc. 1, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> Kühn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 89, § 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <trans><tr>to relax</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 26, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:104:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 104, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
elicitus: <entryFree id="n15476" type="main" key="e_li^ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlĭcĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. elicio.</entryFree>
elicius: <entryFree id="n15477" type="main" key="E_li^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>elicio, I. B.</etym>, <sense id="n15477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because from him celestial signs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">omens were obtained</hi> (or, acc. to others, because <hi rend="ital">he was called down</hi> by incantations), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:328" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 328</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=94" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 94</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 31, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 53, 54, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elidensis: <entryFree id="n15478" type="main" key="E_li^densis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlĭdensis</orth>, v. Elis, II. E.</entryFree>
elido: <entryFree id="n15479" type="main" key="e_li_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-līdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>laedo</etym>. <sense id="n15479.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To knock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">dash out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tear out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to force out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squeeze out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15479.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurigam e curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 261</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem velut e silice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 86, § 214</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flammas ex sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 35, 84, § 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes nubibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 696</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aërem lituis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to produce abortion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 3, 7, § 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <trans><tr>to strike out by syncope</tr>, <tr>to elide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina praelis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to press out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 73; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">herbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:371" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 371</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora equorum eodem elisa, i. e. ad litus ejecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15479.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: animam alicui, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 291, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(imago) recta retrorsum Sic eliditur, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>is thrown back</tr>, <tr>reflected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colores repercussu parietum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 52, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibilum,</quote> <trans><tr>to force out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 51, 112, § 269</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:146" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 22, 28, § 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum,</quote> <trans><tr>to drive out</tr>, <tr>expel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 6</bibl>: magnas sententias, <hi rend="ital">to send forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter</hi> (the fig. being that of a cloud discharging itself), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 11, 7</bibl> Spald.—</sense><sense id="n15479.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dash to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to crush to death.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15479.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">talos alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces,</quote> <trans><tr>to strangle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 142</bibl></cit>: naves, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 27, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem stipite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">draconem pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 11, 11, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminos angues (Hercules),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to strangle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 289</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:17 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 17 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n15479.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to break down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(poetae) nervos omnes virtutis elidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aegritudine elidi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius pactum per posterius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to abrogate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eligans: <entryFree id="n15480" type="main" key="e_li^gans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlĭgans, ēlĭgantia</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ēlĭganter</orth>, v. eleg-.</entryFree>
eligo: <entryFree id="n15481" type="main" key="e_li^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lĭgo</orth>, <itype>lēgi, lectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lĕgo</etym>, <sense id="n15481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pick out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elect</hi> (class.; esp. in the trop. sense; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">coöpto, designo, deligo, seligo): pedes e capite et e collo pullorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvam ad edendum (with legere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:54:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas,</quote> <trans><tr>to pluck up</tr>, <tr>to weed out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 5</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">trop.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 34, 83</bibl></cit> and 84: <cit><quote lang="la">ex malis minima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: ut de tribus<cb n="ELIQ" />  Antoniis eligas quem velis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a multis commodissimum quodque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in comparando difficile ad eligendum sit, quid maxime velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to choose</hi> correctly, <hi rend="ital">make a proper selection</hi>: haud semper errat fama; <cit><quote lang="la">aliquando et elegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n15481.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">picked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">selected; select</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">par columbarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 85, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri electissimi civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">electissima verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Madv. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 26, 36</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">electius verbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">scripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 36, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 36, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.—In the <hi rend="ital">neutr. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlecta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">selections</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 17</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlecte</orth> <hi rend="ital">choicely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 49</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15481.2" n="II" level="1"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">chosen of God</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elected</hi> to be saved, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Col. 3, 12</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
elimatio: <entryFree id="n15482" type="main" key="e_li_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlīmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>elimo</etym>. <sense id="n15482.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a filing away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n15482.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an elucidation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explanation</hi>, Justin. praef. 3 de Emend. Cod. § 3.—</sense><sense id="n15482.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A reducing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lessening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:11:138" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 11, 138</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elimator: <entryFree id="n15483" type="main" key="e_li_ma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlīmātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cleanser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purifier</hi> (eccl. Lat.); <cit><quote lang="la">of Christ,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elimea: <entryFree id="n15484" type="main" key="E^li^me_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlĭmēa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)eli/meia</foreign>, <sense id="n15484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district to the southwest of Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53 al" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 53 al.</bibl>; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Elimiōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 30, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elimes: <entryFree id="n15485" type="gloss" key="e_li_mes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlīmes</orth> <etym>ex-limes</etym>, <foreign lang="greek">a)/poikos, paro/rios</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
elimino: <entryFree id="n15486" type="main" key="e_li_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-līmĭno</orth>, no <sense id="n15486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>limen</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to turn out of doors</hi> (a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> word, mostly ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n15486.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: aliquem, Pac., Att., and Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 38, 31 sq.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem soli patrii finibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to banish</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: se, <hi rend="ital">to go out</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 39, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 292:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 292, 23</bibl>: gradus, <hi rend="ital">to move out</hi>, an old poet ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 31</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n15486.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta foras,</quote> <trans><tr>to blab</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elimo: <entryFree id="n15487" type="main" key="e_li_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-līmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to file up</hi>, viz., </sense><sense id="n15487.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">elimata scobis,</quote> <trans><tr>filings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 50, § 170</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15487.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to polish.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15487.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 176</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <trans><tr>to clean</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15487.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To elaborate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivate; to finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfect</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">sxo/lion</foreign> aliquod, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 7, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum, Aug. contra Acad. 2, 7: elimati, i. q. eruditi, Gell. praef. § 19: Aeneida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:17:10:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15487.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lessen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:14:217" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 14, 217</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlī-mātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">elaborate;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputatio elimatissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Cont. Jul. 5:17" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Cont. Jul. 5, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlīmātĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">more elaborately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more exactly</hi>, Ambros. Hexaëm. 6, 8.</sense></entryFree>
elimpido: <entryFree id="n15488" type="main" key="e_limpi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-limpĭdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">elym-</orth>), <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cleanse out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make quite clean</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 27, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 26, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elinguatio: <entryFree id="n15489" type="gloss" key="e_lingua_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlinguātĭo</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">glwssotomi/a</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
elinguis: <entryFree id="n15490" type="main" key="e_linguis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-linguis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lingua</etym>. <sense id="n15490.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">deprived of a tongue</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 23, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 6, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15490.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15490.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">speechless</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 19</bibl> (with mutus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:post Red. 3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> post Red. 3, 7</bibl> (with mutus and tacitus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:1:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 1, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15490.3" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">without eloquence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 26, 100</bibl>; Cels. praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (opp. disertus).</sense></entryFree>
elinguo: <entryFree id="n15491" type="main" key="e_linguo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-linguo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive of the tongue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 72</bibl>; cf.: ELINGVATVS linguam amisit, Fronto de Diff. Voc. p. 2200 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> P.</sense></entryFree>
elino: <entryFree id="n15492" type="hapax" key="e_li^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lĭno</orth>, <itype>lēvi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bedaub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi>: vestimenta luto, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 103, 30</bibl> (maculavit, Non.; but perh. more correctly, <hi rend="ital">to cleanse completely</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
eliquamen: <entryFree id="n15493" type="spur" key="e_li^qua_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlĭquāmen</orth>, false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 3</bibl>, for liquamina.</entryFree>
eliquatio: <entryFree id="n15494" type="hapax" key="e_li^qua_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlĭquātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>eliquo</etym>, <sense id="n15494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a liquefying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:32:166" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 32, 166</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eliquatus: <entryFree id="n15495" type="main" key="e_li^qua_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlĭquātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clear.— Comp.</hi>: sensa doctrinae, Mar. Mercat. in Verb. Jul. 9, 4.</sense></entryFree>
eliquesco: <entryFree id="n15496" type="hapax" key="e_li^quesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lĭquesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n15496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [liqueo], <hi rend="ital">to become liquid</hi> by being pressed out: <cit><quote lang="la">olea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:55:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 55, 4</bibl></cit>. <cb n="ELLE" /></sense></entryFree>
eliquium: <entryFree id="n15497" type="main" key="e_li^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlĭquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>eliquo</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n15497.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An outlet;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 18, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15497.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A decrease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminution;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae (opp. adauctus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 23, § 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eliquo: <entryFree id="n15498" type="main" key="e_li^quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lĭquo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n15498.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To clarify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strain</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n15498.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum a faecibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15498.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: aliquid plorabile, <hi rend="ital">to recite slowly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">without energy</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:35" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canticum ore tereti semihiantibus labellis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, 15, p. 351, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15498.3" n="II" level="1"> (With the notion of the <hi rend="ital">simplex</hi> predominating.) </sense><sense id="n15498.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to flow clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pour forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluviales aquas (mons),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253</bibl></cit>.—Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">in unum necesse est summitas magnitudinis aliquetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15498.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To sift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine thoroughly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scatebras fluviorum omnes et operta metalla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 260</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elis: <entryFree id="n15499" type="main" key="E_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype> (<case>acc.</case> Elin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 679</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 608</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 550</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:6:47" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 6, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 71, 73, § 181</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:84" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 20, 20, § 84</bibl>: <sense id="n15499.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Elidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <case>abl.</case> usually Elide; <cit><quote lang="la">but Eli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 26, 2</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*h)=lis</foreign>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ālis</orth>, Alidis = Dor. <foreign lang="greek">*)alis</foreign> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 9:26:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 9, 26, 31</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Aleus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">the most westerly district of the Peloponnesus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a capital of the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the vicinity of which Olympia was situated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 694</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 588</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:389" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 389</bibl> et saep.—Of the capital, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 550</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15499.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n15499.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Elean;</hi> and in the poets also for <hi rend="ital">Olympian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Alphēus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 576</bibl></cit>; called also Eleus amnis, Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Olympia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 202</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">carcer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 166</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadriga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9, 17</bibl></cit> (4, 8, 17 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">palma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:2:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit> (4, 1, 60 M.); <cit><quote lang="la">called also Eleus parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:227" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:6:72" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 6, 72</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlēi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Elis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 28, 40, § 175</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15499.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Elis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Eleans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 12, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 6, § 14</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n15499.4" n="C" level="2"> * <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Elean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 11, 32</bibl></cit> Heyne.—</sense><sense id="n15499.5" n="D" level="2"> * <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Elean</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Olympian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15499.6" n="E" level="2"> * <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlĭdensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, of Elis: <cit><quote lang="la">Phaedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:18:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elisio: <entryFree id="n15500" type="main" key="e_li_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>elido</etym>. <sense id="n15500.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A striking out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forcing out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae,</quote> <trans><tr>pressing out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15500.1" n="II" level="1"> In the later grammarians, <hi rend="ital">the striking out of a letter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elision.</hi></sense></entryFree>
elissa: <entryFree id="n15501" type="main" key="E^lissa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlissa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlīsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/elissa</foreign>, another name (occurring only in poetry) for <sense id="n15501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Dido</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 335</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">610</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:18:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 18, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:553 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 553 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n15501.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlis-saeus</orth> (Elīsaeus), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Carthaginian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:346" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hannibal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:239" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:524" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 524</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elisus: <entryFree id="n15502" type="main" key="e_li_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from elido.</entryFree>
elius: <entryFree id="n15503" type="main" key="Elius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Elius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Elis, II. B.</entryFree>
elix: <entryFree id="n15504" type="main" key="e_lix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>elicio</etym>, <sense id="n15504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a channel for diverting a stream</hi>: elix, <foreign lang="greek">a)napnoh\ o)xetou=</foreign>, Gloss.; usually in <number>plur.</number>, v. elices.</sense></entryFree>
elixatura: <entryFree id="n15505" type="main" key="e_lixa_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlixātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>elixo</etym>, <sense id="n15505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thorough boiling;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">any thing boiled</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:9:1 al" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 9, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
elixo: <entryFree id="n15506" type="main" key="e_lixo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlixo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>elixus</etym>, <sense id="n15506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to boil thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seethe</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:3:6 al" default="NO">3, 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
elixus: <entryFree id="n15507" type="main" key="e_lixus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lixus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <etym>lix</etym>, <sense id="n15507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thoroughly boiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seethed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15507.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 62, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:294" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 294</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:85" default="NO">13, 85</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the punning use of the word,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15507.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, qs. sodden, i. e., <hi rend="ital">soaked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet through</hi>: calcei, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 48, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">balneator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit>: nates, i. e. <hi rend="ital">quite flabby</hi> after the bath, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:40" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elleborine: <entryFree id="n15508" type="greek" key="elle^bo^ri_ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ellĕbŏrīne</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hell-</orth>), <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(llebori/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n15508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of hellebore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 20, 35, § 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 9, 52, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elleborismus: <entryFree id="n15509" type="greek" key="elle^bo^rismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ellĕbŏrismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(lleborismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purgative made from hellebore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">destillandus etiam elleborismus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:108" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elleborites: <entryFree id="n15510" type="greek" key="ellebo^ri_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ellebŏrītes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hell-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(llebori/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n15510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hellebore wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elleboro: <entryFree id="n15511" type="main" key="elle^bo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ellĕbŏro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hell-</orth>) (no <sense id="n15511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> nor <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>), <pb n="639" /> <cb n="ELOQ" /> <itype>are</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>elleborus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to purify with hellebore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:77" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elleborosus: <entryFree id="n15512" type="main" key="elle^bo^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ellĕbŏrōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hell-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in need of hellebore</hi> (i. e.), <hi rend="ital">out of his senses: Gr.</hi> Quaeso, sanun es? <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Sum elleborosus. <hi rend="ital">Gr.</hi> Ut ego cerritus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elleborus: <entryFree id="n15513" type="greek" key="elle^bo^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ellĕbŏrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hell-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ellĕ-bŏrum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hell-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n15513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hellebore</hi>, in pure Lat. veratrum, a plant much used by the ancients as a remedy for mental diseases, epilepsy, etc.; the best grew on the island of Anticyra, in the Aegean Sea, Pl. 25, 5, 21; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 25, 13, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 451</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ellipsis: <entryFree id="n15514" type="main" key="ellipsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ellipsis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">en-l-</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/lleiyis</foreign>, in rhet. lang., <sense id="n15514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ellipsis</hi> (pure Lat. detractio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 21</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 40</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:89" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ellops: <entryFree id="n15515" type="main" key="ellops"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ellops</orth>, <itype>ŏpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. helops.</entryFree>
ellum: <entryFree id="n15516" type="main" key="ellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ellum</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ellam</orth>, v. ecce.</entryFree>
ellychnium: <entryFree id="n15517" type="greek" key="ellychni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ellychnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)llu/xnion</foreign>, <sense id="n15517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lamp-wick</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 41, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:168" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 11, 47, § 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:29" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eloco: <entryFree id="n15518" type="main" key="e_lo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lŏco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to let</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hire out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let out to farm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bovem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 7, § 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sese curandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 1, 3, § 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentem Judaeorum, i. q. ejus vectigalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
elocutilis: <entryFree id="n15519" type="hapax" key="e_lo^cu_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlŏcūtĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>eloquor</etym>, <sense id="n15519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oratorical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facundia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 258, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elocutio: <entryFree id="n15520" type="main" key="e_lo^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlŏcūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n15520.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a speaking out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utterance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expression</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluralis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15520.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in rhet. lang., <hi rend="ital">oratorical delivery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elocution;</hi> the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fra/sis</foreign> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">locutio, dictio, stilus, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:7:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; Quint. prooem. § 22; 8 prooem. § 13; 8, 1, 1 et saep.</sense></entryFree>
elocutorius: <entryFree id="n15521" type="main" key="e_lo^cu_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlŏcūtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to oratorical expression</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">elocu-toria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">elocutrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, as a translation of <foreign lang="greek">r(htorikh/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">rhetoric</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 14, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elocutus: <entryFree id="n15522" type="main" key="e_lo^cu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlŏcūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from eloquor.</entryFree>
elogio: <entryFree id="n15523" type="main" key="e_lo^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlŏgĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>elogium</etym>, <sense id="n15523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to describe briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to state</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:16" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:4:66" default="NO">5, 4, 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elogium: <entryFree id="n15524" type="main" key="e_lo^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lŏgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>logus; cf. Rost. Opusc. <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> I. p. 93 sq.</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n15524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an utterance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">short saying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentence.</hi>—In partic. </sense><sense id="n15524.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A short maxim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Solonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 20, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15524.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An inscription</hi> on a tombstone (so most freq.), Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 17, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:14:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 14, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1 al.</bibl> (Vide old examples of such Elogia in Orell. Inscr. 534 sq.) Also on doors, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 74</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">on the images of ancestors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">on votive tablets,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15524.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A clause</hi> in a will (especially which disinherits one), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:48:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 48, 135</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:2:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:10:1:section=9" default="NO">37, 10, 1, § 9</bibl>; Suet. Vita Hor. <hi rend="ital">sub init.;</hi> hence, in the Cod. Just., ultima elogia, for <hi rend="ital">last will</hi> or <hi rend="ital">testament</hi> in gen., Cod. 3, 28, 37, § 1 al.—</sense><sense id="n15524.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A judicial statement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">record</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abstract</hi> in criminal cases (respecting the criminal's offence, punishment, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sever. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sever. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertices sub uno elogio jussit occidi,</quote> <trans><tr>a single warrant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so the jurid. expression: mittere aliquem cum elogio,</quote> <trans><tr>to send a criminal before the proper magistrates</tr>, <tr>with a specification of his offence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:3:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:3 al" default="NO">49, 16, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
elonginquo: <entryFree id="n15525" type="main" key="e_longinquo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-longinquo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>e-longinquus</etym>, <sense id="n15525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Enarr. in Psa. 43, § 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elongo: <entryFree id="n15526" type="main" key="e_longo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlongo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>e-longe</etym>. <sense id="n15526.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep aloof</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium tuum a me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:21:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 21, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium a nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:59:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 59, 9 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n15526.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To prolong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 14, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. elongo, <foreign lang="greek">makru/nw, a)fi/sthmi</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.—</sense><sense id="n15526.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce elongavi fugiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:54:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 54, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sir. 35, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 3, § 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elops: <entryFree id="n15527" type="main" key="elops"><orth extent="full" lang="la">elops</orth>, <itype>ŏpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. helops.</entryFree>
eloquens: <entryFree id="n15528" type="main" key="e_lo^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlŏquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from eloquor.</entryFree>
eloquenter: <entryFree id="n15529" type="main" key="e_lo^quenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlŏquenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n15529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eloquently</hi>, v. eloquor, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi> <cb n="ELUC" /></sense></entryFree>
