eloquentia: <entryFree id="n15530" type="main" key="e_lo^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlŏquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>eloquor</etym>, <sense id="n15530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being eloquent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eloquence</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 23, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 32, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:17:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:7" default="NO">2, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 8, 30</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
eloquium: <entryFree id="n15531" type="main" key="e_lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n15531.0" n="I" level="1"> In Aug. poets, and their imitators among prose writers, for eloquentia, <hi rend="ital">eloquence</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 217</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 383</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:46" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">322 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:68:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 68, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 17, 18, § 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15531.1" n="II" level="1"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">declaration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">communication</hi> in gen., <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 413</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Pan. Maxim. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquia pulchritudinis,</quote> <trans><tr>fine words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:49:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 49, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:4:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. 4, 20 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
eloquor: <entryFree id="n15532" type="main" key="e_lo^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lŏquor</orth>, <itype>ēlŏcūtus</itype> (or ēloquūtus), 3, <sense id="n15532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to speak out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speak plainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to utter; to pronounce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">express</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloqui hoc est, omnia quae mente conceperis promere atque ad audientes perferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit> prooem. § 15 (class.). </sense><sense id="n15532.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (so most freq. in Plautus). </sense><sense id="n15532.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod sentit eloqui non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare cogitata mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 72 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen meum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> prol. 18: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum hujus tragoediae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 51</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">96: rem, ut facta est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.: ille unum elocutus, ut memoria tenerent milites, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 34, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gratum elocuta consiliantibus Junone divis "Ilion, Ilion," etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15532.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perge eloqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 4, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquar an sileam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 39</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15532.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to speak</hi> in an oratorical or eloquent manner (only <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>): et Graece ab eloquendo <foreign lang="greek">r(h/twr</foreign> et Latine eloquens dictus est, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloqui copiose melius est, quam vel acutissime sine eloquentia cogitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 44, 156</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">composite, ornate, copiose eloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquendi facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 69</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlŏquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n15532.5" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endowed with the faculty of speech</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum res muta fit eloquens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15532.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Eloquent</hi> (for syn. cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facundus, disertus, etc.): Is est eloquens, qui et humilia subtiliter et magna graviter et mediocria temperate potest dicere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:100 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 29, 100 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 36, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Antonius disertos ait se vidisse multos, eloquentem omnino neminem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 18</bibl></cit> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl> prooem. § 13; 12, 1, 21; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 20, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senator (Cato),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:18:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 18, 24</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 8</bibl> Bip.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:58" default="NO">4, 2, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:3" default="NO">5, 13, 3</bibl>; 8 prooem. § 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:39:145" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 39, 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlŏquen-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">eloquently</hi>: eloquenter, <foreign lang="greek">logi/ws</foreign>, Gloss. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentius quam prius scribitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 18, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentissime respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 21, 4</bibl>.!*? <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlŏcūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in pass. signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">an quaedam extrinsecus sint elocuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:13:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 13, § 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elorus: <entryFree id="n15533" type="main" key="E^lo_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlōrus</orth>, v. Helorus.</entryFree>
elotus: <entryFree id="n15534" type="main" key="e_lo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from elavo.</entryFree>
elpenor: <entryFree id="n15535" type="main" key="Elpe_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Elpēnor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)elph/nwr</foreign>, <sense id="n15535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the companions of Ulysses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom Circe changed into swine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:22" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 22</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">being afterwards disenchanted, he fell from a roof while drunk, and broke his neck,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:483" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 483</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elpinice: <entryFree id="n15536" type="main" key="Elpi^ni_ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Elpĭnīce</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n15536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sister of Cimon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eluacrus: <entryFree id="n15537" type="main" key="e_lu^a_crus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlŭācrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>eluo</etym>, <sense id="n15537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">for washing out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rinsing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labrum,</quote> <trans><tr>a wash-tub</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:10:4" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 10, 4</bibl></cit>, and 11, 3 dub. (al. vinarium).</sense></entryFree>
eluceo: <entryFree id="n15538" type="main" key="e_lu_ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lūcĕo</orth>, <itype>xi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n15538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shine forth</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. sense and in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n15538.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter flammas circulus elucens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:16:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 16, 16</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the golden <hi rend="ital">glittering</hi> of bees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa flamma, quae ex L. Marcii capite eluxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15538.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shine out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show itself; to be apparent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">appareo, exsisto, effero): scintilla ingenii jam tum elucebat in puero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 19, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 28, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:4 al" default="NO">8, 6, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo elucebit omnis constantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 102</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Haec (benevolentia) magis elucet inter aequales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 101</bibl></cit>; id. Fam. <cb n="ELUG" /> 4, 3, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum prius est enarrandum, quo ratio eluceat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 1, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1051 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1051 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
elucesco: <entryFree id="n15539" type="main" key="e_lu_cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlūcesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n15539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [eluceo], <hi rend="ital">to shine forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin to shine</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Retr. 1, 13</bibl>: elucesco, <foreign lang="greek">parekfainein</foreign>, Gloss.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to dawn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec dies elucescat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Pet. 1, 19.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam elucesceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 9, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elucido: <entryFree id="n15540" type="main" key="e_lu_ci^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lūcĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lucidus</etym>, <sense id="n15540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlighten</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 24, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elucifico: <entryFree id="n15541" type="main" key="e_lu_ci^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lūcĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lucificus</etym>, <sense id="n15541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive of light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blind</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 106, 21</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, al. lucificare.</sense></entryFree>
eluctabilis: <entryFree id="n15542" type="hapax" key="e_lucta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēluctābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>eluctor</etym>, <sense id="n15542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from which one may extricate one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:8:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eluctatio: <entryFree id="n15543" type="hapax" key="e_lucta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēluctātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a struggling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">struggle.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus mala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eluctor: <entryFree id="n15544" type="main" key="e_luctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-luctor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n15544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n15544.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to struggle out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force one's way out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 244</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of streams,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 219</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse, compositus alias, et velut eluctantium verborum, promptius eloquebatur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hesitating in speech</tr>, <tr>unready</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15544.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to struggle out of</hi> any thing; also, <hi rend="ital">to surmount</hi> a difficulty, <hi rend="ital">to obtain by striving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot ac tam validas manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum difficultates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:525" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 525</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">viam ponti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:184" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 184</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elucubro: <entryFree id="n15545" type="main" key="e_lu_cubro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lūcubro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">elucu-bror</orth>, deponent: <sense id="n15545.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">epistolam, quam eram elucubratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 19</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">to compose by lamplight</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">at night</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with great labor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 90 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10 praef.</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
elucus: <entryFree id="n15546" type="main" key="e_lu_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lūcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lux</etym>.—Prop., one who has been awake all night; hence, <sense id="n15546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drowsy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dreaming person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:19:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 19, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:12:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 7</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=75:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 75, 17</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
eludo: <entryFree id="n15547" type="main" key="e_lu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n15547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n15547.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to finish play</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">cease to sport</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roll</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum autem mare sic terram appetens litoribus eludit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 100</bibl></cit> (Bait. cludit): <cit><quote lang="la">solebat Aquilius litus ita definire, qua fluctus eluderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:7:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 7, 31</bibl></cit> (al. alluderet); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 34</bibl>: eludere proprie gladiatorum est cum vicerint, et eludere est finem ludo imponere, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15547.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15547.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To win from</hi> one at play (very rare).—Constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquem aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulus, Quem parasitus hic te elusit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">elusi militem in alea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi victrices ... Eludet palmas una puella tuas,</quote> <trans><tr>will snatch away from you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 140.—Far more freq. and class. (esp. in the transf. sense), </sense><sense id="n15547.4" n="B" level="2"> A gladiator's t. t., <hi rend="ital">to elude</hi> or <hi rend="ital">parry</hi> an enemy's blow: <cit><quote lang="la">callidus emissas eludere simius hastas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:202" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caestus cito motu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 163</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi rudibus ejus eludit oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 6, 17</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <trans><tr>to make in vain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15547.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to delude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frustrate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15547.6" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 6, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 58, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:45" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:36" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 695</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:19" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 19</bibl> et saep.; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 33, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus scrutantium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 97, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum quiete, quietem bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem miraculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultionem praevaricando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicia seditionis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to invalidate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15547.7" n="b" level="4"> In partic., with the accessory notion of mockery, <hi rend="ital">to mock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jeer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make sport of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et vos ab illo irridemini et ipsi illum vicissim eluditis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 28</bibl> et saep.; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eludet, ubi te victum senserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 79</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam alicujus (opp. extollere suam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 2</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
elugeo: <entryFree id="n15548" type="main" key="e_lu_ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lūgĕo</orth>, <itype>xi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to mourn for</hi> any <pb n="640" /> <cb n="ELUV" /> one, <hi rend="ital">to be in mourning for</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">virum (mulier),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">cognate acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:5:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid, cum eluxerunt, sumunt?</quote> <trans><tr>have completed their time of mourning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elumbis: <entryFree id="n15549" type="main" key="e_lumbis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lumbis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lumbus</etym>, <sense id="n15549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hip-shot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having the hip dislocated.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15549.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: evulso lumbo, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=76:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 76, 13</bibl> Müll. (dub.). —</sense><sense id="n15549.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of style: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceronem male audisse a Bruto, ut ipsius verbis utar, tamquam fractum atque elumbem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>enervated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 18</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n15549.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: virus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that weakens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enervates</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 216.</sense></entryFree>
eluminatio: <entryFree id="n15550" type="gloss" key="e_lu_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlūmĭnātĭo</orth>, <sense id="n15550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enlightening</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">fwtismo/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
eluminatus: <entryFree id="n15551" type="main" key="e_lu_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lūmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lumen</etym>, <sense id="n15551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deprived of light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blinded</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
eluo: <entryFree id="n15552" type="main" key="e_lu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wash out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rinse out; to wash off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wash clean</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n15552.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vascula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum (the silver vessels, the plate),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bacas immundas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:4" default="NO">6, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculas vestium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 8, 28, § 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:29:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 29, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpureum colorem omnibus undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1077" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1077</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">atramentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 25, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se asinino lacte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 24</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15552.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15552.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To purify</hi>: vasa eluto auro, <hi rend="ital">of pure gold</hi> (al. elato), <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pertin. 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15552.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lay bare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ponticum Phasim et stagna Maeotidis (sc. avibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15552.5" n="b" level="4"> In Plautus (like elavo, II.), <hi rend="ital">to strip one's self of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get rid of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squander</hi> one's property, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:21 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 21 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of money lavished on expensive baths: elutum in balineis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15552.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to dispose of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">wash away</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut centurionum profusus sanguis eluatur: num elui praedicatio crudelitatis potest?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">infectum scelus sub gurgite vasto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 742</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tales amicitiae sunt remissione usus eluendae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to get rid of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amara curarum (cadus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15552.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cleanse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make pure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes maculatas crimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:200" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 200</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 59" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 19, 34</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">washed out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">watery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insipid;</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irriguo nihil est elutius horto (= magis fatuum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(spodi) elutior vis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 33, § 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elusa: <entryFree id="n15553" type="main" key="E^lu^sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlŭsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n15553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Gallia Aquitania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Eauze</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 137</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 14</bibl>.—Hence,</sense></entryFree>
elusates: <entryFree id="n15554" type="main" key="Elusa_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Elusātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gallic tribe in Aquitania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elusco: <entryFree id="n15555" type="main" key="e_lusco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lusco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>luscus</etym>, <sense id="n15555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make one-eyed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of an eye</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:5:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 5, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:4:17" default="NO">10, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:3:3 al" default="NO">13, 3, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
elusus: <entryFree id="n15556" type="main" key="e_lu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from eludo.</entryFree>
elutio: <entryFree id="n15557" type="hapax" key="e_lu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>eluo</etym>, <sense id="n15557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a washing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elutrio: <entryFree id="n15558" type="main" key="e_lu_tri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlūtrĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n15558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to wash out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15558.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: lintea, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 133</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n15558.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to decant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rack off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 17, 21, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
elutus: <entryFree id="n15559" type="main" key="e_lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from eluo and elavo.</entryFree>
eluvies: <entryFree id="n15560" type="main" key="e_lu^vi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlŭvĭes</orth>, <itype>em, e</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>eluo</etym>, <sense id="n15560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a washing away</hi> of impurities, <hi rend="ital">a flowing off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharge.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15560.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 82, 84, § 197</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 40, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:32" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 32</bibl>: ventris, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 103, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 9" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15560.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an overflowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an inundation</hi> of a river, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">eluvie mons est deductus in aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 267</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 57</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n15560.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a chasm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abyss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravine</hi> produced by the violent rushing of water, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (shortly before: vorago concursu cavata torrentium); 6, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—In <number>plur.</number> (with voragines), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15560.4" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of a ruinous law: <cit><quote lang="la">ad illam labem atque eluviem civitatis pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 20, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
eluvio: <entryFree id="n15561" type="main" key="e_lu^vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlŭvĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, older form of eluvies, <sense id="n15561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a washing away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overflowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inundation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum eluviones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="EMAN" /> 49, 111: <cit><quote lang="la">eluviones et exustiones terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:21:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 21, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 5, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eluxurior: <entryFree id="n15562" type="hapax" key="e_luxu^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-luxŭrĭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n15562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put forth luxuriantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites pampinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
elvina: <entryFree id="n15563" type="main" key="Elvi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Elvīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Helvina.</entryFree>
elymais: <entryFree id="n15564" type="main" key="E^lyma_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlymāis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)elumai/+s</foreign>, <sense id="n15564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district of Persia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the west of the modern province of Iran</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:111 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 25, 28, § 111 al.</bibl>— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlymaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)elumai=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Elymaean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 40</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕlymaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Elymaïs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:48 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 48 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
elysii: <entryFree id="n15565" type="main" key="Elysii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Elysii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n15565.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people of Eastern Germany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Oder and the Vistula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15565.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Elysian Fields</hi>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> II.</sense></entryFree>
elysium: <entryFree id="n15566" type="main" key="E_ly^si^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlysĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)hlu/sion</foreign>, the abode of the blest, <sense id="n15566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Elysium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 735</bibl> Serv.; 6, 542; 744 al.; cf. Heyne <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:675 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 675 sq.</bibl>; and ejusd. libri Exc. VIII. p. 1019 Wagn.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n15566.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēlysĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Elysian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:58" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:175" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 175</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:101" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 111</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chaos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:520" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 520</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 60: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Proserpine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:24" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15566.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Elysii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. campi), <hi rend="ital">the Elysian Fields</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:52" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 699</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
em: <entryFree id="n15567" type="main" key="em1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">em</orth>, i. q. eum, v. is <sense id="n15567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15568" type="main" key="em2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">em</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, = hem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:56" default="NO">1, 56</bibl>.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15569" type="main" key="em3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">em</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, = en (freq. in Plaut. and Ter. in best MSS.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:prol. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. prol. 3</bibl> (v. Brix ad loc.); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 2, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 146</bibl> Ussing ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 6 al.</bibl>, v. en.</entryFree>
emaceratus: <entryFree id="n15570" type="hapax" key="e_ma^ce^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-măcĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [macero], <sense id="n15570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emaciated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
emacesco: <entryFree id="n15571" type="main" key="e_ma^cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-măcesco</orth>, <itype>cŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n15571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become emaciated</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emacio: <entryFree id="n15572" type="main" key="e_ma^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-măcĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n15572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to waste away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make lean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emaciate</hi> (belonging to econom. lang.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:1" default="NO">2, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:6:3" default="NO">4, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 25, § 101</bibl> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
emacitas: <entryFree id="n15573" type="main" key="e^ma_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕmācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>emax</etym>, <sense id="n15573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a propensity to buy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a desire to be always buying</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emacresco: <entryFree id="n15574" type="main" key="e_macresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-macresco</orth>, <itype>crŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n15574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow lean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become emaciated</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 4</bibl> and 5.</sense></entryFree>
emaculo: <entryFree id="n15575" type="main" key="e_ma^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-măcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clear from spots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to purify</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n15575.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 19, 75, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:5:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 278</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15575.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum odoribus Arabicis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emanatio: <entryFree id="n15576" type="main" key="e_ma_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmānātĭo</orth>, <itype>onis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>emano</etym>, <sense id="n15576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an emanation</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 7, 25</bibl>; Hilar. Synod. 20.</sense></entryFree>
emancipatio: <entryFree id="n15577" type="main" key="e_manci^pa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmancĭpātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">emancup-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>emancipo</etym>.—Jurid. t. t. <sense id="n15577.0" n="I" level="1"> In the strict sense of the term, <hi rend="ital">the releasing of a son</hi> (by means of a thrice-repeated mancipatio and manumissio) <hi rend="ital">from the</hi> patria potestas, <hi rend="ital">so as to render him independent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emancipation</hi> (v. emancipo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:132" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:12:section=6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 12, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15577.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> in gen. </sense><sense id="n15577.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The formal surrender</hi> of any thing, the <hi rend="ital">delivery of authority over</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">fundorum,</quote> <trans><tr>conveyance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15577.3" n="2" level="3"> Familiae, <hi rend="ital">a fictitious alienation of property in making a will</hi> per aes et libram, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 27, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emancipator: <entryFree id="n15578" type="main" key="e_manci^pa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmancĭpātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an emancipator</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 184</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emancipo: <entryFree id="n15579" type="main" key="e_manci^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mancĭpo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ēmancŭpo</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>—Jurid. t. t. <sense id="n15579.0" n="I" level="1"> In the strict sense, <hi rend="ital">to put out of the hand</hi> and <hi rend="ital">power of</hi> the paterfamilias; <hi rend="ital">to declare free and independent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to emancipate</hi> a son from the patria potestas by the thrice-repeated act of mancipatio and manumissio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:132 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 132 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:12:section=6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 12, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 2</bibl> et saep.; cf. Sandars, Just. Inst. introd. p. 37 sq.— </sense><sense id="n15579.1" n="II" level="1"> In a wider sense, <hi rend="ital">to give from under one's own power</hi> or <hi rend="ital">authority into that of another.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15579.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">filium in adoptionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 4</bibl>, and Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=77:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 77, 6</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: praedia paterna, Quint. <cb n="EMAT" /> 6, 3, 44.—</sense><sense id="n15579.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the jurid. sphere, <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier, tibi me emancupo: tuus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:12" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(senectus) si jus suum retinet, si nemini emancipata est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 11, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">venditus atque emancipatus tribunatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 21, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emanco: <entryFree id="n15580" type="main" key="e_manco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-manco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>mancus</etym>, <sense id="n15580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to maim</hi>, Labien. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
emaneo: <entryFree id="n15581" type="main" key="e_ma^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mănĕo</orth>, <itype>nsi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> * <sense id="n15581.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To stay without</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain beyond</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:650" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 650</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n15581.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stay away beyond one's leave of absence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exceed one's furlough</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:3:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 3, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emano: <entryFree id="n15582" type="main" key="e_ma_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-māno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n15582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flow out</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. signif. and in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n15582.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 583</bibl>; Cic. poët. Div. 2, 30; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:32:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 32, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:5:6 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 5, 6 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15582.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15582.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To spring out of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emanate from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii quoque allo ex fonte praeceptores dicendi emanaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 8, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo (loco) vis omnis oportet emanet ratiocinationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:37:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 37, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 189</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc haec recentior Academia emanavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istinc mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singularem eloquii suavitatem ore ejus emanaturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n15582.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To spread itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be diffused</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emanabat latius malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:9:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n15582.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic., of things that are made public, <hi rend="ital">to spread abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become known</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio in vulgus emanare poterit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 5:17" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 5, 17</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:16" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 35</bibl> et saep.; cf. with a <hi rend="ital">subject acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis emanabat indiciis fratrem Volscii ne assurrexisse quidem ex morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 24, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emansio: <entryFree id="n15583" type="hapax" key="e_mansi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmansĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>emaneo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n15583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a remaining absent beyond one's furlough</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:4:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 4, § 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emansor: <entryFree id="n15584" type="main" key="e_mansor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmansor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who exceeds his furlough</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:3:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 3, § 2</bibl>; ib. § 5 al.</sense></entryFree>
emarcesco: <entryFree id="n15585" type="main" key="e_marcesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-marcesco</orth>, -marcui, 3, <sense id="n15585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wither away</hi> (very rare).—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to dwindle away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 36, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refugium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ies. 5, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor meum,</quote> <trans><tr>fainted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:21:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 21, 4 al.</bibl></cit>† † <orth extent="full" lang="la">emarcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> <etym>a Gallic word</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of vine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producing a wine of middling quality</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 25</bibl> (called also marcus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 32</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
emargino: <entryFree id="n15586" type="hapax" key="e_margi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-margĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive of its edge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 41, § 147</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emasculator: <entryFree id="n15587" type="hapax" key="e_mascu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmascŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>emasculo</etym>, <sense id="n15587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pederast</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 321, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emasculo: <entryFree id="n15588" type="main" key="e_mascu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mascŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>masculus</etym>, <sense id="n15588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to castrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emasculate</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">asinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotes herbis quibusdam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to render impotent</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 661</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emathia: <entryFree id="n15589" type="main" key="E_ma^thi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēmăthĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)hmaqi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n15589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district of Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 44, 5</bibl>; Justin. 7, 1, 1.—</sense><sense id="n15589.1" n="B" level="2"> In <usg type="style">poet.</usg> meton. </sense><sense id="n15589.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 390</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15589.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Thessaly</hi>, and esp. for <hi rend="ital">Pharsalia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 492</bibl> Serv. and Heyne; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>—</sense><sense id="n15589.4" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n15589.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēmăthĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Emathian</hi>, i. e. in <usg type="style">poet.</usg> meton., </sense><sense id="n15589.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Macedonian</hi>: Perses, Corn. Sever. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Alexander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:5:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 5, 39</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the same: manes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:117" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 117</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Alexandria</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15589.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Thessalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pelion</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in Pharsalia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 531</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the same: clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:950" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 950</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 245</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15589.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: ventus, Lucil. ap. Jul. Rufin. de Fig. § 26 Ruhnk.—</sense><sense id="n15589.9" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēmăthis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Emathian</hi>, i. e. </sense><sense id="n15589.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Macedonian;</hi> as a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēmăthĭdes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the daughters of the Macedonian king Pierus</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">Pierides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 669</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15589.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Thessalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 580</bibl></cit>; cf. as a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Emathis</orth>, i. q. Emathia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 350</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ematuresco: <entryFree id="n15590" type="main" key="e_ma_tu_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mātūresco</orth>, <itype>rŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n15590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow quite ripe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come to maturity</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n15590.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 17, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 7</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n15590.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow softer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be mitigated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:124" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ematuro: <entryFree id="n15591" type="hapax" key="e_ma_tu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mātūro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ripen completely</hi>,<pb n="641" /> <cb n="EMEN" />  <hi rend="ital">to bring to maturity</hi>: fruges (calor), Eumen. <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Act. ad Const. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emax: <entryFree id="n15592" type="main" key="e^max"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕmax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>emo; cf.: edax, bibax, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n15592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eager to buy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fond of buying</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:2" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 3, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 421</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tu prece poscis emaci,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that vows a price for its fulfilment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
embaenetica: <entryFree id="n15593" type="greek" key="embaene^ti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">embaenĕtĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mbainetikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n15593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an artificial appetite</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 4</bibl> Bait. (al. emetica, q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
embamma: <entryFree id="n15594" type="greek" key="embamma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">embamma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/mbamma</foreign>, <sense id="n15594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sauce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:57" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 53, § 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:88 al" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 44, § 88 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
embasicoetas: <entryFree id="n15595" type="greek" key="emba^si^coetas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">embăsĭcoetas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mbasikoi/tas</foreign>, i. q. cinaedus, and likewise <sense id="n15595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of an obscenely shaped drinking - vessel;</hi> hence, in a double sense, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 24, 1</bibl> and 2.</sense></entryFree>
embasis: <entryFree id="n15596" type="greek" key="emba^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">embăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/mbasis</foreign>, <sense id="n15596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bathing in any thing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:8:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:17:151 al" default="NO">3, 17, 151 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
embates: <entryFree id="n15597" type="greek" key="emba^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">embătes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mba/ths</foreign>, archit. t. t., <sense id="n15597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a model</hi>, Lat. modulus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emblema: <entryFree id="n15598" type="greek" key="emble_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emblēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype> (<sense id="n15598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> emblematis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 22</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 27</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/mblhma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">inlaid work.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15598.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Raised ornaments</hi> on vessels, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 32</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15598.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Tessellated work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mosaic</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
embola: <entryFree id="n15599" type="greek" key="embo^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">embŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mbolh/</foreign>, <sense id="n15599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting on board</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shipment</hi> (late Lat.), Cod. Th. 1, 2, 10; Novell. 163, 2.</sense></entryFree>
emboliaria: <entryFree id="n15600" type="main" key="embo^li^a_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">embŏlĭārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>embolium</etym>, <sense id="n15600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an actress who performed in the interludes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 158</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 660, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
embolimaeus: <entryFree id="n15601" type="greek" key="embo^li^maeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">embŏlĭmaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mbolimai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n15601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inserted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intercalary</hi> (pure Lat. intercalaris): <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Eclog. de Rat. Dier. 13</bibl></cit>. Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">embŏlĭmus</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">e)mbo/limos</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emboline: <entryFree id="n15602" type="main" key="embo^li_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">embŏlīnē</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n15602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, now unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 20, 35, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
