embolismus: <entryFree id="n15603" type="main" key="embo^lismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">embŏlismus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mbolismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intercalary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <trans><tr>leap-year</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 17, 21 sq.</bibl></cit>—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">embolismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the interposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intercalation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 6, 17, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
embolium: <entryFree id="n15604" type="greek" key="embo^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">embŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mbo/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n15604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">something thrown in;</hi> in scenic lang., <hi rend="ital">an interlude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ballet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:54:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 54, 116</bibl> (embolia pertinent ad gestus saltatorios, Schol.).</sense></entryFree>
embolum: <entryFree id="n15605" type="greek" key="embo^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">embŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/mbolon</foreign>, <sense id="n15605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the beak of a ship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aēneum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 30, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
embolus: <entryFree id="n15606" type="greek" key="embo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">embŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/mbolos</foreign>, in mechanics, <sense id="n15606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the piston of a pump</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
embrocha: <entryFree id="n15607" type="greek" key="embro^cha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">embrŏcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mbroxh/</foreign>, <sense id="n15607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wet poultice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emeditatus: <entryFree id="n15608" type="hapax" key="e_me^di^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mĕdĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [meditor], <sense id="n15608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">studied out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">studied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artfully devised</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 126</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emedullatus: <entryFree id="n15609" type="main" key="e_me^dulla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mĕdullātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [medullo], <sense id="n15609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deprived of the marrow.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n15609.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 43, § 87</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n15609.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes,</quote> <trans><tr>enervated</tr>, <tr>feeble</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emendabilis: <entryFree id="n15610" type="main" key="e_menda_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmendābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>emendo</etym>, <sense id="n15610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be amended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capable of correction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">error,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emendate: <entryFree id="n15611" type="main" key="e_menda_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmendātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n15611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faultlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfectly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purely</hi>, v. emendo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
emendatio: <entryFree id="n15612" type="main" key="e_menda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmendātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>emendo</etym>, <sense id="n15612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a correction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amendment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emendation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 9</bibl> (with correctio); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:10" default="NO">2, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:13" default="NO">13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 78, § 210</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:16:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 16, § 2</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
emendator: <entryFree id="n15613" type="main" key="e_menda_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmendātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a corrector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amender</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:259" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 74, 259</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:6:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 6, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 7, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emendatorius: <entryFree id="n15614" type="main" key="e_menda_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmendātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">corrective</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>purifying</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 27" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 27 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
emendatrix: <entryFree id="n15615" type="main" key="e_menda_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmendātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>emendator</etym>, <sense id="n15615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who corrects</hi> or <hi rend="ital">amends</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum emendatricem legem esse oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:22:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 22, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emendatus: <entryFree id="n15616" type="main" key="e_menda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmendātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from emendo.</entryFree>
emendico: <entryFree id="n15617" type="main" key="e_mendi_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mendīco</orth>, no <sense id="n15617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to obtain by begging</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">stipem a populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:91" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 91 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 54</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 9, 2, 14 al.</sense></entryFree>
emendo: <entryFree id="n15618" type="main" key="e_mendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mendo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>mendum</etym>,<cb n="EMER" />  <sense id="n15618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to free from faults</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to correct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amend</hi> (cf. corrigo—class.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Caes.): tota civitas emendari et corrigi solet continentia principum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 13, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:14" default="NO">2, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:89" default="NO">9, 3, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leviter tuum consilium (with conformare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinem vitiosam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia adolescentiae multis virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta priora novis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:596" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 596</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res Italas legibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem severius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucos acerbos in pomis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">terram terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 5, 3, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bovem cubitorem fame et siti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angorem animi (sui),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq. of <hi rend="ital">correcting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emending</hi> language (oral or written), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:4" default="NO">8, 2, 4</bibl> et saep.—In medic. lang., like corrigere, for <hi rend="ital">to cure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alopecias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 50, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tussim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 16, 62, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">albugines oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7, 24, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatrices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 21, 42, § 156</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n15618.1" n="II" level="1"> In post-class. lang. in partic., <hi rend="ital">to correct by punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to chastise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertum non obsequentem aut verbis aut fustium castigatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:9:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 9, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 22 al.</bibl>— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmendātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">faultless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e. et Latina locutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:33" default="NO">33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:15 al" default="NO">2, 4, 15 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 121</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo (with optimus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: libri, Quint. Ep. ad Tryph. § 3; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">correcta et emendata maxime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmendāte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">faultlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfectly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui, scribere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:1" default="NO">8, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8</bibl> prooem. § 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 11</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere capillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 19</bibl> Zumpt.</sense></entryFree>
emensio: <entryFree id="n15619" type="main" key="e_mensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>emetior</etym>, <sense id="n15619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the completion of a course</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 6, 17, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emensus: <entryFree id="n15620" type="main" key="e_mensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from emetior.</entryFree>
ementior: <entryFree id="n15621" type="main" key="e_menti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mentĭor</orth>, <itype>ītus, 4</itype>, <sense id="n15621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">utter falsely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to feign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fabricate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretend</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae dixisti modo, Omnia ementitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:33:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 33, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:7:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 49, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 63, 5 al.</bibl>—And with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:30:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 30, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:42 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 42 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to feign being any one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 82, 3</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego haec omnia Chrysogonum fecisse dico, ut ementiretur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 66</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alii ementiti sunt in eos, quos oderant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concessum est rhetoribus ementiri in historiis,</quote> <trans><tr>to depart from truth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 11, 42</bibl></cit>.!*? <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmentītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">forged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fabricated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretended</hi>, C. Memmius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 21, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:24:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 24, 58</bibl>; Apul. M. 4, 5, p. 245; Diet. Cret. 1, 20.</sense></entryFree>
emeo: <entryFree id="n15622" type="hapax" key="e_me^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mĕo</orth>, no <sense id="n15622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to pass through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emeato mari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emercor: <entryFree id="n15623" type="main" key="e_mercor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mercor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n15623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to buy up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bribe</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">adulterium ingentibus donis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditum principis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritiam praefecti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 14</bibl>.!*? <orth extent="full" lang="la">emercor</orth>, <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emere: <entryFree id="n15624" type="gloss" key="emere"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emere</orth> <itype>antiqui dicebant pro accipere</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=4:18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 4, 18</bibl>, and 76, 1 Müll.; cf. adimo and demo.</entryFree>
emereo: <entryFree id="n15625" type="main" key="e_me^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mĕrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and (perh. not ante-Aug.) <orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mĕrĕor</orth>, <itype>ĭtus, 2</itype>, <sense id="n15625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15625.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To obtain by service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deserve.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15625.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): quid ego emerui mali?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 61: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi altior sollicitudo, quale judicium hominum, emererer, accessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">emerendi favoris gratia canunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: pecuniam ex eo quaestu uberem, Gell, 6, 7, 5.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf. clause</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">Ennius emeruit Contiguus poni, Scipio magne, tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 410</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 58</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emerito caput insere caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:19" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 19</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:464" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 464</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 209</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15625.3" n="B" level="2"> <cb n="EMER" /> In Tib. and Ov. emerere aliquem, like demereri aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to gain the favor of</hi> any one, <hi rend="ital">to deserve well of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lay under obligation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:60" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Her. 6, 138</bibl>.—Far more frequent, </sense><sense id="n15625.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To serve out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi> one's term of service. </sense><sense id="n15625.5" n="A" level="2"> Prop., in milit. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">spes emerendi stipendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 6</bibl></cit>; in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emerita stipendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 84, 2</bibl></cit> Kritz.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 14, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43 al" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 43 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:15:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 43</bibl>.—As a <hi rend="ital">v. dep.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendia emeritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmĕrĭ-tus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a soldier who has served out his time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a veteran</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an exempt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:344 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 344 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15625.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the milit. sphere: <cit><quote lang="la">annuum tempus (sc. magistratus) emeritum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">annuae operae emerentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium juventae (homo) transit, et emeritis medii quoque temporis annis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 226</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">emeritus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (since the Aug. per. in the mid. signif.), <hi rend="ital">that has become unfit for service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worn out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:688" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 688</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">apes fessae et jam emeritae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 11, 11, § 27</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">palmes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:665" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 665</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus (with invalidum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 11, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:498" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>burned out</tr>, <tr>extinguished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 72.</sense></entryFree>
emergo: <entryFree id="n15626" type="main" key="e_mergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mergo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n15626.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring to light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise up</hi> (very rare; mostly with se, or pass. in mid. sense), <hi rend="ital">to come forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emerge</hi> (not in Plaut., Caes., Verg., or Hor.). </sense><sense id="n15626.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">emersere e gurgite vultus Nereides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex undis Cancri pars sese emergit in astra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 198</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">se torrens imo hiatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se lux pelago,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi (somnianti) subito sum visus emersus e flumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 68</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">emersus e palude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emersus paludibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernis et emersas in lucem tendere noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 186</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">nox emersa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:399" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 399</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15626.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to extricate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">free one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise one's self up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese ex malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 30</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo emersus subito ex diuturnis tenebris lustrorum ac stuprorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tu emersus e caeno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut emerso ab admiratione animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Once perh. <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut possim rerum tantas emergere moles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 116</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. and class.,</sense><sense id="n15626.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (i. q. the preceding emergere se), <hi rend="ital">to come forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emerge.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15626.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15626.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">equus emersit e flumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e vadis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:23:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 23, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de paludibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab infima ara (anguis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub exsistentibus glebis (pisces),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 2</bibl></cit>: extra aquam <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 18, 32, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:203" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 88, 89, § 203</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foras (with exsilire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suam lucem (luna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 37</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Antiati in Appiam ad Tres Tabernas,</quote> <trans><tr>to get away</tr>, <tr>escape</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">e patrio regno (with Cappadociae latebris se occultare),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegre in apertos campos (Manlius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 25 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves, quae se in mari mergerent: quae cum emersissent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: sol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 76</bibl> (also, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:44:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 44, 113</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">stellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:58 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 14, 11, § 58 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi> tot res repente circumvallant, unde emergi non potest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15626.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to come forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break forth</hi>, as a plant or animal, when it springs up or is born: <cit><quote lang="la">viriditas e vaginis emergit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flos ex caule,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 66, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totus infans utero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 51, 112, § 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 52, 74, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 82, 84, § 198</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15626.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to extricate one's self from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise one's self up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to emerge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get clear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex sermone emersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex miserrimis naturae tuae sordibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex peculatus judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex paternis probris ac vitiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex mendicitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixdum e naufragiis prioris culpae cladisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex obnoxia pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex omni saevitia fortunae (virtus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: cum tam multa ex illo mari (sc. Ponto) bella emerserint, <hi rend="ital">have arisen</hi>, <pb n="642" /> <cb n="EMIC" /> <hi rend="ital">broken out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem multos vidi emersisse aliquando, et se ad frugem bonam, ut dicitur, recepisse,</quote> <trans><tr>have raised themselves up</tr>, <tr>have risen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac autem re incredibile est quantum civitates emerserint,</quote> <trans><tr>have raised themselves up</tr>, <tr>elevated themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summas opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quod fastigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:65" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:164" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 164</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis enim demersae sint leges, emergunt tamen haec aliquando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:65:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 65, 183</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc emergit amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo magis emergit, quale sit decorum illud, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>appears</tr>, <tr>is evident</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti sceleris indicium per Fulviam emersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:1:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emerita: <entryFree id="n15627" type="main" key="E_me^ri^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēmĕrĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n15627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Lusitania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Merida</hi>, Mela, 2, 6, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 41, 65, § 141</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēmĕrĭtānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Emerita</hi>, Murat. Inscr. 1550, 1.— <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēmĕrĭtensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Emerita</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 35, § 117</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Emeri-tenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Emerita</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emeritus: <entryFree id="n15628" type="main" key="e_me^ri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmĕrĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <sense id="n15628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, from emereo, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
emersus: <entryFree id="n15629" type="main" key="e_mersus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmersus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from emergo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15630" type="main" key="e_mersus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmersus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>emergo</etym>, <sense id="n15630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coming out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coming forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an appearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emerging</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">serpentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 46, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 22, 38, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 25, 58, § 218</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emeticus: <entryFree id="n15631" type="main" key="e_me^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmĕtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)metiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emetic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turning the stomach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bolbus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 55</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: † <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕmĕtĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)metikh/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an incitement to vomit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an emetic</hi> (employed by the Roman gourmands as the means of renewed gluttony), Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 4</bibl> (cf. bibit et vomit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:432" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 432</bibl>; dub.; Bait. embaeneticam; al. pineticam, or peneticam).</sense></entryFree>
emetior: <entryFree id="n15632" type="main" key="e_me_ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mētĭor</orth>, <itype>mensus, 4</itype>, <sense id="n15632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to measure out</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n15632.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 772</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longitudines et altitudines vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:18:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 18, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15632.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15632.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pass through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse</hi> a certain space: <cit><quote lang="la">cum freta, cum terras omnis, tot inhospita saxa Sideraque emensae ferimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 628</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:17" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 17</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 20, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 16 al.</bibl>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagi terraeque laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:53" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 53</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in Tacitus, of time: Galba quinque principes prosperā fortunā emensus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>having survived</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15632.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To impart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beslow</hi>: non aliquid patriae tanto emetiris acervo? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 105</bibl>: ego voluntatem tibi profecto emetior, sed rem ipsam nondum posse videor, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 4, 16</bibl>.!*? <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif. (acc. to II. A. and B.). </sense><sense id="n15632.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Passed through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traversed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo major pars itineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 30, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 450</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:182" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 182</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:351" default="NO">4, 351</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15632.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Imparted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distributed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emeto: <entryFree id="n15633" type="hapax" key="e_me^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mĕto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to mow away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mow down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus frumenti agris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 245</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emicatim: <entryFree id="n15634" type="hapax" key="e_mi^ca_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmĭcātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>emico</etym>, <sense id="n15634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">springing forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosiliens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
emicatio: <entryFree id="n15635" type="hapax" key="e_mi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a springing forth</hi>: emicationes silvarum, App. de Mundo, p. 71, 29.</sense></entryFree>
emico: <entryFree id="n15636" type="main" key="e_mi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mĭco</orth>, <itype>cŭi</itype> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 17</bibl>), <itype>cātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n15636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear quickly</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; in Cic. and Caes. not at all). </sense><sense id="n15636.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">emicat ex oculis, spirat quoque pectore flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma ex monte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 88, 89, § 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi calami ex una radice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 8, 40, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dracones de extis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 77, § 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgura ab omni parte caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>: corpore sanguis (so Lachm.; <cit><quote lang="la">Munro, e corpore),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque pronus carcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 652</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaturigines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor alte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis per foramen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scintillae inter fumum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol super terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:96" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 96</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:655" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum nervo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa tormento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 10</bibl></cit>: hostem rati, emicant, sine discrimine insultant, <hi rend="ital">rush</hi> <cb n="EMIN" /> <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18, 4</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">(sanguis) in illam partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1050" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1050</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum manus emicat ardens in litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in currum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nisus ante omnia corpora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis in altum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami in excelsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 5, 11, § 23 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. comically: cor coepit in pectus emicare, <hi rend="ital">to leap</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15636.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stretch forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">project</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulus alto gurgite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 225</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15636.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be prominent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conspicuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become apparent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter quae verbum emicuit si forte decorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippinae is pavor, ea consternatio mentis emicuit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 16</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of good qualities, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos et magnitudine animi et claritate rerum longe emicuisse,</quote> <trans><tr>to have shone forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregia virtus Scaevae centurionis emicuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:40" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter ceteros Themistoclis gloria emicuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:9:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 9, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emigratio: <entryFree id="n15637" type="hapax" key="e_mi_^gra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmī^grātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>emigro</etym>, <sense id="n15637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a removal from a place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emigration</hi> (late Lat. for migratio): <cit><quote lang="la">inquilinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emigro: <entryFree id="n15638" type="main" key="e_mi_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mī^gro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n15638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15638.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depart</hi> from a place, <hi rend="ital">to emigrate</hi> (rare but classical): <hi rend="ital">Se.</hi> Quid tu ais? num hinc emigrasti? <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Quem in locum? etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:70 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 70 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex illa domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 14</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">e vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:19:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 19, 48</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hasce aedis pedem nemo intro tetulit, semel ut emigravimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:10:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 10, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui post hunc casum emigraverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:N. Q. 6:1:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> N. Q. 6, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15638.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (only ante- and postclass.). </sense><sense id="n15638.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To remove</hi>: senia et jurgia sesemet aedibus emigrarunt, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 2, 18</bibl> (Com. v. 148 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">emigrabit te tabernaculo suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 51, 5</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n15638.4" n="B" level="2"> Scripturas, <hi rend="ital">to transgress</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eminatio: <entryFree id="n15639" type="spur" key="eminatio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eminatio</orth>, false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 19</bibl>: conminatio, Brix: minatio, Fleck., Ritschl.</entryFree>
eminens: <entryFree id="n15640" type="main" key="e_mi^nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from emineo.</entryFree>
eminenter: <entryFree id="n15641" type="main" key="e_mi^nenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmĭnenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n15641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">highly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminently</hi>, v. emineo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
eminentia: <entryFree id="n15642" type="main" key="e_mi^nenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>eminens</etym>, <sense id="n15642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standing out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projecting;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">a prominence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protuberance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15642.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:section=174" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 38, § 174</bibl> (with soliditas); App. Flor. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 18, p. 359; and in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 174</bibl>. —Hence, in painting, <hi rend="ital">the prominent</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">light parts</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 20</bibl> (opp. umbrae). —</sense><sense id="n15642.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">excellence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam formarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:11:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectutis suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 6, 19</bibl></cit>.—Hence, per eminentiam, i. q. <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">preëminently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">par excellence</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 11, 3</bibl>: reperiet, eminentiam cujusque operis artissimis temporum claustris circumdatam, <hi rend="ital">the highest ability</hi> in an art, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:17:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 17, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emineo: <entryFree id="n15643" type="main" key="e_mi^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n15643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stand out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">project</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n15643.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15643.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">exstare, excedere): cum ex terra nihil emineret, quod contemplationi caeli officere posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">globus terrae e mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipites ex terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stipites ab ramis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">3: belua ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes aequore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 667</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi extra terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balaena dorso multum super aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super corpus quasi verrucula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum per costas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 41, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:780" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 780</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">alte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta in partes ambas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum in mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 24, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua in altum (i. e. mare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15643.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in painting, <hi rend="ital">to stand out in relief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be prominent</hi>, as the lights in a picture, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:26" default="NO">8, 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:131 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 131 al.</bibl>; cf. eminentia, I.—</sense><sense id="n15643.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be prominent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become conspicuous</hi> (syn.: eluceo, praecello, excello, appareo, praesto, antecedo). </sense><sense id="n15643.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">animus, cum erit inclusus in corpore, eminebit foras,</quote> <trans><tr>will extend beyond</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 26</bibl></cit> Mos.: <cit><quote lang="la">ii quorum eminet audacia atque projecta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:65:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 65, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod quo studiosius ab ipsis opprimitur et absconditur, eo magis eminet et apparet,</quote> <trans><tr>comes out</tr>, <tr>becomes visible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 62</bibl> <cb n="EMIN" /> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:56" default="NO">11, 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:73" default="NO">11, 3, 73</bibl> Spald.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 10 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:50" default="NO">8, 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:250" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 250</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix ex gratulando miser jam eminebam,</quote> <trans><tr>was but now emerging from the flood of congratulations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox eminet una,</quote> <trans><tr>makes itself distinctly audible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 607</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15643.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to be prominent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conspicuous</hi> through one's (good) qualities, <hi rend="ital">to distinguish one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be eminent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthenes unus eminet inter omnes in omni genere dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:5" default="NO">12, 5, 5</bibl>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">super</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:6" default="NO">2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:64 al" default="NO">8, 3, 64 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:127:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 127, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:130:1" default="NO">2, 130, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:65" default="NO">3, 8, 65</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">excellit atque eminet vis, potestas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with excellit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (sententiarum ornamenta) emineant pauciora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 24, 81</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:49 al" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 49 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">standing out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prominent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15643.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (syn. editus): <cit><quote lang="la">promontoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 93, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae leviter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capita papaverum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:7:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 7, 7</bibl>: aedes, <hi rend="ital">standing on high ground</hi> (opp. plana), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:9:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil (in globo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 27</bibl>; cf. also the art. eminentia: patibulo eminens affigebatur, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 366, 14</bibl> (4, 40 Dietsch).—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasus a summo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of perspective in painting: alia eminentiora, alia reductiora fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 46</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquod in montibus (i. e. vertex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:49" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15643.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminent</hi> (esp. freq. in the postAug. per., and mostly in the <hi rend="ital">sup.;</hi> syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclarus, praestans, excellens, etc.): species deorum quae nihil solidi habeat, nihil eminentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: res dictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:114:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 114, 1</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">eminentis fortunae comes invidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:Pat. 1:9:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> Pat. 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmĭnentes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished men</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 5</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n15643.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Admirable passages</hi> in an oration, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:86" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 86</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15643.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Greatness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nun. quam eminentia invidia carent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:40:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 40, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:10" default="NO">1, 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:1" default="NO">2, 3, 1</bibl>; 9, 4, 79 et saep.; cf. Ruhnk. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:83" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 83 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— In the later empire, Eminentissimus was <hi rend="ital">a title of the</hi> Praefectus praetorio, <hi rend="ital">and of the</hi> Magister militum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 47, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 41, 11</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmĭnenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">highly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminently</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> in Psa. 95, 1</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">projectae cautes eminentius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non eminentius quam municipaliter natus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of higher</tr>, <tr>nobler birth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eminiscor: <entryFree id="n15644" type="gloss" key="e_mi^niscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mĭniscor</orth>, <itype>mentus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n15644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [v. comminiscor], <hi rend="ital">to devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">EMINISCITVR, COMMINISCITVR, REMINISCITVR, SVBMINISCITVR, Not. Tir.: EMENTVM, excogitatio, Gloss. Isid.: ingeniosior ad eminiscendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 12</bibl>. Acc. to conjecture, also in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 2, 1</bibl> Heusing <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (others read: comminisci and reminisci); and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=44" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 44</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. reminisci).</sense></entryFree>
eminor: <entryFree id="n15645" type="spur" key="eminor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eminor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 11</bibl>: minor, Fleck.</entryFree>
eminulus: <entryFree id="n15646" type="main" key="e_mi^nu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmĭnŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n15646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [emineo], <hi rend="ital">projecting a little</hi> (perh. only in Varro): <cit><quote lang="la">genua (boum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:9:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 4.</sense></entryFree>
eminus: <entryFree id="n15647" type="main" key="e_mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mĭnus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>manus; cf. the opp. comminus; lit., hands apart, i. e. not hand to hand</etym>, <sense id="n15647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">aloof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at fighting distance</hi> with missiles, <hi rend="ital">a spear's-throw off</hi> (cf.: longe, procul). </sense><sense id="n15647.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., a milit. t. t., used of fighting with missiles, spears, etc. (class.), mostly opp. comminus: <cit><quote lang="la">eminus fundis, sagittis reliquisque telis pugnabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 26</bibl></cit>. 1; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 50, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:101:4" default="NO" valid="yes">101, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 346</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">645</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">776</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 21, 13</bibl> saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">of throwing fire, etc.: alii faces de muro in aggerem eminus jaciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 24, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15647.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">at a distance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from a distance</hi> (mostly postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnationem eminus incipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 41</bibl></cit>: fer opem eminus unam, Ov. <pb n="643" /> <cb n="EMIT" /> P. 1, 6, 17; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Her. 16, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:904" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 904</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:7:650" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 650</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emiror: <entryFree id="n15648" type="main" key="e_mi_ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mīror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n15648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> (qs. ex intimo animo demiror), <hi rend="ital">to wonder greatly at</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> so <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 274</bibl> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. miratus); <bibl default="NO"><author>Placid.</author> p. 251</bibl> Munck.</sense></entryFree>
