emisceo: <entryFree id="n15649" type="hapax" key="e_misce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-miscĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to mingle by pouring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mix</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 244</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emissarium: <entryFree id="n15650" type="main" key="e_missa_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmissārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>emitto</etym>, <sense id="n15650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an outlet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacūs,</quote> <trans><tr>a drain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 20, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 229" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 229</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">collectionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:ib. 206" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 206</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emissarius: <entryFree id="n15651" type="main" key="e_missa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmissārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.; sent out, put forth; hence</etym>, <sense id="n15651.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An emissary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 8</bibl> Ascon.; 2, 3, 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15651.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in eccl. Lat. </sense><sense id="n15651.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An attendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the guard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:22:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 22, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15651.3" n="2" level="3"> Caper emissarius, <hi rend="ital">the scapegoat</hi>, sent to bear the sins of the people to the wilderness, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Levit. 16, 8 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15651.4" n="II" level="1"> In botany, <hi rend="ital">a young branch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shoot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 208</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emissicius: <entryFree id="n15652" type="main" key="e_missi_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmissīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sent out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put forth;</hi> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>prying about</tr>, <tr>spying</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ocelli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emissio: <entryFree id="n15653" type="main" key="e_missi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sending out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">darting forth</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n15653.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a letting go</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radiorum ex oculis,</quote> <trans><tr>a darting forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:16:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortui sunt in emissione,</quote> <trans><tr>in exile</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Baruch. 2, 25</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n15653.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">power of projecting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hurling;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviores telorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 57</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a letting go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">releasing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:29:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 29, 62</bibl></cit> (thrice).</sense></entryFree>
emissor: <entryFree id="n15654" type="main" key="e_misso^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmissŏr</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who sends out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throws out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liber et Libera seminum commotores et emissores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Civ. D. 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emissus: <entryFree id="n15655" type="main" key="e_missus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from emitto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15656" type="hapax" key="e_missus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmissus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>emitto</etym>, <sense id="n15656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sending forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emission</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 205</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emitesco: <entryFree id="n15657" type="hapax" key="e_mi_tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mītesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n15657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become mild</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mellow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 10</bibl></cit> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
emitto: <entryFree id="n15658" type="main" key="e_mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mitto</orth>, <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to send out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">send forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let go</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n15658.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15658.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibuscum tamquam e carceribus emissus sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 101</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aperiam carceres et equos emittere incipiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex porta ludis cum emissu'st lepus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem e carcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex vinculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem e custodia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 49, 118</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 1</bibl>).—As milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to send out</hi> against the enemy: <cit><quote lang="la">essedarios ex silvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">equitibus emissis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar omnibus portis eruptione facta equitatuque emisso hostes in fugam dat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 51, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 58, 4 et saep.: aliquem de carcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Licinium fugere conantem de manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 48</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: Hannibalem e manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and merely manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem noctu per vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pabulatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 81, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 76, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sub jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut abs te non emissus ex urbe, sed immissus in urbem esse videatur,</quote> <trans><tr>sent out</tr>, <tr>turned out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutum manu,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw away</tr>, <tr>throw aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pila,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw</tr>, <tr>hurl</tr>, <tr>cast</tr>, <tr>discharge</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 17</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam in fines eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam ex lacu Albano,</quote> <trans><tr>to let off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam impetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus Velinus, a Curio emissus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen per prona montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem de aure,</quote> <trans><tr>to let</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem venis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 23, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 24, 29, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <trans><tr>to put forth</tr>, <tr>produce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 20, 49, § 182</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">transf.: ulmi emittuntur in ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 12, 18, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum de arte aleam ludendi,</quote> <trans><tr>to put forth</tr>, <tr>publish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid dignum nostro nomine emittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitum ex alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 694</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitum linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1044" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1044</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <trans><tr>to utter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 548</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1088" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1088</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 54</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">flatum crepitumque ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: animam, <hi rend="ital">to expire</hi>, Nep. <cb n="EMOD" /> Epam. 9, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:27:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 27, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nubium conflictu ardor expressus se emiserit, id esse fulmen,</quote> <trans><tr>has broken forth</tr>, <tr>burst forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 19, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15658.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: manu emittere aliquem for the usu. manu mittere aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to release a person from one's</hi> potestas, <hi rend="ital">to set free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emancipate</hi> (anteclass. and since the Aug. per.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 8, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 6, 14</bibl> et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 18, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so without manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 19</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of a debtor: libra et aere liberatum emittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n15658.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to let forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">send out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus manifesta suis emittere quoquam,</quote> <trans><tr>to let slip from our hands that which is evident</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 504</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">emissa de manibus res est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illud facetum dictum emissum haerere debeat (a fig. borrowed from missive weapons),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 219</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et semel emissum volat irrevocabile verbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:53:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 53, 214</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">maledictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
emmanes: <entryFree id="n15659" type="greek" key="emma^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emmănes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mmanh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant</hi> hyoscyamus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emmoton: <entryFree id="n15660" type="greek" key="emmo^ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emmŏton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/mmoton</foreign>, <sense id="n15660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a salve spread on lint</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emo: <entryFree id="n15661" type="main" key="e^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕmo</orth>, <itype>ēmi, emptum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n15661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> emissim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 39</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>the same word with EMERE=accipere, Paul. ex Fest. pp. 4, 18, and 76, 1 Müll.; cf. adimo and demo; prop., to take; root yam; Sanscr. yamati, hold fast, Fick, Vergl. Wört. p. 158 sq.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 598" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 598</bibl> note</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to buy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchase</hi> (very freq. in all periods and kinds of composition). </sense><sense id="n15661.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">is postquam hunc emit, dedit eum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui puellam ab eo emerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emit hosce de praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epid. 1, 1, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 31, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <case>abl.</case> pretii (cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 444): <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Quanti eam emit? <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Vili. <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Quot minis? <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Quadraginta minis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 1, 1, 49 sq.</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti, quanti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minoris aut pluris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 12, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:5:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 5, 3 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duodeviginti minis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duobus milibus nummum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno, parvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immenso quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:39 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 39 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cheap</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 23, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">male,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dear</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">care,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatuor tabernas in publicum,</quote> <trans><tr>for the public</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:16" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 16</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piper in libras,</quote> <trans><tr>by the pound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 7, 14, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundum in diem,</quote> <trans><tr>on time</tr>, <tr>on credit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per assem et libram,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to adopt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:64 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 64 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Perf. part. pass.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15661.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">empta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">she who is bought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 9, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n15661.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">emptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the purchase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contract of purchase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ex empto aut vendito aut conducto aut locato contra fidem fiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>through buying and selling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in jurid. lang.: ex empto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the title: De actionibus empti et venditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 49</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: emere oportet, quem oboedire velis tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15661.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to buy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buy up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to purchase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquando desinat ea se putare posse emere, quae ipse semper habuit venalia, fidem, jusjurandum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias (judicum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">animos centurionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his (tribunis plebis) emitur ab inimicis meis is, quem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 33, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percussorem in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem beneficiis,</quote> <trans><tr>to gain over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem dote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem pretio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immortalitatem morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternum nomen sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmenta laboribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem dolore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 55</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">a clause</hi> as object, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:620" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 620</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtis in manibus emptum est Oedipodae sedisse loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:163" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantine emptum velit Hannibal, ut nos Vertentes terga aspiciat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:287" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 287</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emoderor: <entryFree id="n15662" type="hapax" key="e_mo^de^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mŏdĕror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n15662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to moderate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem verbis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to vent</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 130</bibl></cit>. <cb n="EMOR" /></sense></entryFree>
emodulor: <entryFree id="n15663" type="main" key="e_mo^du^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mŏdŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n15663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emolimentum: <entryFree id="n15664" type="main" key="e_mo^li^mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmŏlĭmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. emolumentum.</entryFree>
emolior: <entryFree id="n15665" type="main" key="e_mo_li^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mōlĭor</orth>, <itype>ītus</itype> (<sense id="n15665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass. parag.</hi> emolirier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 5, 2</bibl>), 4, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to move out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring out by effort</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fretum (venti),</quote> <trans><tr>to stir up</tr>, <tr>agitate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 476" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nauseam pituitae per nares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <trans><tr>to effect</tr>, <tr>accomplish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emollio: <entryFree id="n15666" type="main" key="e_molli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mollĭo</orth>, <itype>ii, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make soft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to soften</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n15666.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">humor arcus fundasque et jaculorum amenta emollierat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova macerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 60, 80, § 167</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:77" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 7, 17, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 2, 6, § 11 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15666.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">colores,</quote> <trans><tr>to soften</tr>, <tr>make more delicate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 17, 57, § 198</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15666.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15666.4" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">to make mild</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gentle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mollify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:9:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 9, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severa praecepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 48" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15666.5" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to enervate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">render effeminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum (Capua),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">emollit gentes clementia caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem principis,</quote> <trans><tr>to weaken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 1" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emolo: <entryFree id="n15667" type="main" key="e_mo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mŏlo</orth>, no <sense id="n15667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to grind up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15667.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 5, 23, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 64, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Tob. 21, 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15667.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grind out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume by grinding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">granaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:26" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emolumenticius: <entryFree id="n15668" type="main" key="e_mo^lu^menti^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmŏlŭmentĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>emolumentum</etym>, <sense id="n15668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to gain</hi>, terror, <hi rend="ital">dread of losing profits</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 9, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emolumentum: <entryFree id="n15669" type="main" key="e_mo^lu^mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmŏlŭmentum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmŏlĭmentum</orth> (cf. monumentum), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>emolior; lit., a working out; hence</etym>, <sense id="n15669.0" n="I" level="1"> A striving for success, i. e. <hi rend="ital">effort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exertion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">labor</hi> (cf. elaboro; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely): neque enim magnum emolumentum esse potest,</quote> <trans><tr>can present no great difficulty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14, 1</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 34</bibl>, the true reading is molimento). —* </sense><sense id="n15669.1" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a building</hi>, etc.: vetera, Cod. Th. 15, 1, 19.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n15669.2" n="II" level="1"> The attainment of success, i. e. <hi rend="ital">gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benefit</hi> (syn.: lucrum, quaestus, compendium, commodum, fructus, reditus). </sense><sense id="n15669.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: et emolumenta et detrimenta (quae <foreign lang="greek">w)felh/mata</foreign> et <foreign lang="greek">bla/mmata</foreign> appellant) communia esse voluerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. detrimentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 16, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. damnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum emolumentum esse, nullum injustitia partum praemium tantum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with praemium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:85:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 85, 346</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with utilitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni nullo emolumento impelluntur in fraudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 12, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 8, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 18, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 7</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 166</bibl> et saep.; of <hi rend="ital">persons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quam maximum emolumentum novis sociis esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 22, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15669.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emolumenta rerum fallacibus judiciis vident ... poenam non vident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:105" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 105 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:114:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 114, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergastulorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 4, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:22" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacramentorum (with praemia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 35</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">honoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emoneo: <entryFree id="n15670" type="hapax" key="e_mo^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mŏnĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to admonish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit> Bait. (dub.;al. moneo).</sense></entryFree>
emorior: <entryFree id="n15671" type="main" key="e_mo^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mŏrĭor</orth>, <itype>mortuus, 3</itype> (old form of the <sense id="n15671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> emoriri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 42</bibl>; but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 124</bibl>, moriri, Ritschl), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to die off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decease</hi>, v. Doed. Syn. 3, p. 183 sq. (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n15671.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">emori me malim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Asin. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:32:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 32, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 3, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:26 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 26 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 243</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 19, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:52:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 52, 1, 4</bibl>.—Prov.: verba facit emortuo, <hi rend="ital">he talks to the dead</hi>, i. e. in vain, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15671.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">to become dead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 221</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carbo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to go out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterilis et emoriens terra,</quote> <trans><tr>desert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vulva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15671.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to perish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum laus emori non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta (with evanescere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 75</bibl></cit>: spes <pb n="644" /> <cb n="EMPL" /> (opp. elucere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 654</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emortualis: <entryFree id="n15672" type="hapax" key="e_mortu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmortŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>emorior</etym>, <sense id="n15672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies (opp. natalis),</quote> <trans><tr>the day of one's death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 139</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emortuus: <entryFree id="n15673" type="main" key="e_mortuus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmortuus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <sense id="n15673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dead</hi>, from emorior.</sense></entryFree>
emotus: <entryFree id="n15674" type="main" key="e_mo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from emoveo.</entryFree>
emoveo: <entryFree id="n15675" type="main" key="e_mo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mŏvĕo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">exmov-</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 59</bibl>), mōvi, mōtum, 2 (<sense id="n15675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. sync.</hi> emostis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to move out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; esp. in Livy; not in Cic. and Caes.). </sense><sense id="n15675.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinem e foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem de medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatos curiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">milites aedificiis, 27, 3: aliquos senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 15</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">postes cardine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antiochum ultra juga Tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:42" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 42</bibl>; 50; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos cis Vulturnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 34</bibl></cit>: labias primores sensim, <hi rend="ital">to protrude</hi>, Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <trans><tr>to dig out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muros fundamentaque,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to shake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 610</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pontum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to stir up</tr>, <tr>agitate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:284" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 284</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15675.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: SI MORBUS PESTILENTIAQUE EX AGRO ROMANO EMOTA ESSET, an old formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suum nomen omne ex pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: curas dictis, <hi rend="ital">to drive away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expel</hi> (with pellere dolorem), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 382</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens emota,</quote> <trans><tr>disturbed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Polyb. 37:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Polyb. 37, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
empanda: <entryFree id="n15676" type="gloss" key="Empanda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Empanda</orth> <itype>paganorum dea</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=76:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 76, 11</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
empedocles: <entryFree id="n15677" type="main" key="Empe^do^cles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Empĕdŏcles</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n15677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> -cli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:11:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 11, 9</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> -clem, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 12, 44</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">-clen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit> al.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)empedoklh=s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a famous natural philosopher of Agrigentum</hi>, about 460 B. C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:716 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 716 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:8" default="NO">3, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 4, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 465</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n15677.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Empĕdoclēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Empedoclean</hi>: sanguis (acc. to his doctrine, <hi rend="ital">the soul</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 17</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.— Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Empĕdoclēa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Empedoclean doctrines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
empetros: <entryFree id="n15678" type="greek" key="empe^tros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">empĕtros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/mpetros</foreign>, <sense id="n15678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant called in pure Lat.</hi> calcifraga, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 51, § 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emphanisticum: <entryFree id="n15679" type="greek" key="empha^nisti^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emphănistĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mfanistiko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n15679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a duty paid by a priest for the ordination</hi>, Julian. Ep. Nov. c. 50, § 191.</sense></entryFree>
emphasis: <entryFree id="n15680" type="greek" key="empha^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emphăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/mfasis</foreign>, a figure of rhet., <sense id="n15680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emphasis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rhetorical stress</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pondus, significatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:11" default="NO">8, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:86 al" default="NO">8, 3, 86 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
emphragma: <entryFree id="n15681" type="greek" key="emphragma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emphragma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/mfragma</foreign>, <sense id="n15681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stoppage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstruction</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 12</bibl> and 19 (1, 40; 47 Bip.).</sense></entryFree>
emphyteusis: <entryFree id="n15682" type="greek" key="emphy^teusis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emphyteusis</orth>, <itype>ĕos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mfu/teusis</foreign> (lit., an implanting), in jurid. lang., <sense id="n15682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a permanent tenure of land upon condition of cultivating it properly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and paying a stipulated rent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sort of fee-farm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">copyhold</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 66, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 3:25:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 3, 25, 3</bibl>; cf. Rein's Privatr. p. 168 sq.; Dict. of Antiquities, s. v. emphyteusis.</sense></entryFree>
emphyteuta: <entryFree id="n15683" type="greek" key="emphy^teuta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emphyteuta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mfuteu/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n15683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lessee in the tenure of emphyteusis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 66, 1 sq.</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">emphyteu-tĭcārĭus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 62, 1</bibl>; the latter also <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to emphyteusis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedium, contractus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 66, 2 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
emphyteuticus: <entryFree id="n15684" type="greek" key="emphy^teuti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emphyteutĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mfuteutiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to emphyteusis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus, contractus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 66, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. the preced. art.</sense></entryFree>
empirice: <entryFree id="n15685" type="greek" key="empi_ri^ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">empīrĭce</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-ca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, Marc. de Med. 6), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mpeirikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n15685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">empiricism</hi> in medicine, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a system founded wholly on practice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 4, § 5</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">empīrĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an empiric</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a physician whose knowledge of medicine is derived from experience only</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 122</bibl> (in Cels. praef. and 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>, written as Greek); <hi rend="ital">their writings</hi> were called <orth extent="full" lang="la">empīrĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 12, 48, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emplastratio: <entryFree id="n15686" type="main" key="emplastra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emplastrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>emplastro</etym>, in horticult. lang., <sense id="n15686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the insertion of a small piece of the bark in inoculating a tree</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">scutcheon-grafting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">budding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 26:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:59" default="NO">11, 2, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:118 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 16, 26, § 118 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emplastro: <entryFree id="n15687" type="main" key="emplastro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emplastro</orth>, no <sense id="n15687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, in <cb n="EMPT" /> horticult. lang., <hi rend="ital">to inoculate by inserting a bit of the bark with the eye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to scutcheongraft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bud</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:37" default="NO">11, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mai. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Nov. 7, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emplastrum: <entryFree id="n15688" type="greek" key="emplastrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emplastrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">emplastra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">e)/mplastron</foreign>. <sense id="n15688.0" n="I" level="1"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">a plaster.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15688.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes">19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 39, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:103" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 10, 22, § 103</bibl> et saep.—* </sense><sense id="n15688.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: quid est jusjurandum? Emplastrum aeris alieni, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> —</sense><sense id="n15688.3" n="II" level="1"> In horticult. lang., <hi rend="ital">the band of bark which surrounds the eye in ingrafting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the scutcheon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 26:9 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 26, 9 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 16, 26, § 121</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 17, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
emplecton: <entryFree id="n15689" type="greek" key="emplecton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emplecton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/mplekton</foreign> (lit., interwoven), <sense id="n15689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rubble-work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sort of masonry in which the space between two walls is filled with broken stones and mortar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 51, § 171</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl>, as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
emponema: <entryFree id="n15690" type="main" key="empo^ne_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">empŏnēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mpo/nhma</foreign>, <sense id="n15690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the value added to land by culture</hi>: melioratio, vel ea quae emponemata dicuntur, Cod. 4, 66, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Julian.</author> Epit. Nov. 7, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emporeticus: <entryFree id="n15691" type="greek" key="empo^re_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">empŏrētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mporhtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to trade</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">charta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>packing-paper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:76:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 76, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 10, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emporia: <entryFree id="n15692" type="main" key="Empo^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Empŏrĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)empo/ria</foreign>, <sense id="n15692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district on the shore of the Lesser Syrtis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 25 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
emporiae: <entryFree id="n15693" type="main" key="Empo^ri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Empŏrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)empori/ai</foreign>, <sense id="n15693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">near the Pyrenees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:369" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 369</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Its inhabitants</hi> were called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Empŏritāni</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 16, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emporium: <entryFree id="n15694" type="greek" key="empo^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">empŏrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mpo/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n15694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place of trade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a market-town</hi>, <hi rend="ital">market</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emporium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:10" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 10</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 41, 1; 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:72 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 72 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
emporus: <entryFree id="n15695" type="greek" key="empo^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">empŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/mporos</foreign>, <sense id="n15695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merchant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epist. 22, 28</bibl>.—Emporos, <hi rend="ital">title of a play of Philemon</hi> (the Mercator of Plautus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emprosthotonia: <entryFree id="n15696" type="greek" key="emprostho^to^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emprosthŏtŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mprosqotoni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n15696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disease in which the limbs are drawn forward and stiffen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:6:61" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 6, 61</bibl>.—The same called <orth extent="full" lang="la">empro-sthŏtŏnos</orth> (=<foreign lang="greek">e)mprosqo/tonos</foreign>) morbus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 3:6:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6, 65</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">emprosthŏtŏ-nĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mprosqotoniko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">suffering from this disease</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 69.</sense></entryFree>
empticius: <entryFree id="n15697" type="main" key="empti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emptīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">emt-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>emo</etym>, <sense id="n15697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchased</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">glans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salsamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:17:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of slaves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 7:21:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 7, 21, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Spendon et Hermes empticii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2812</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">empticius an domi natus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 47, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:12:44 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 12, 44 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
emptio: <entryFree id="n15698" type="main" key="empti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emptĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">emt-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a buying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchase</hi> (cf.: sectio, mercatura, etc.). </sense><sense id="n15698.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:3:5" default="NO">2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 34</bibl> et saep.; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, on its legal relations,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:139" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 139</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">the title: De emptione et venditione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 3:23" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 3, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1</bibl>; and Rein's Privatr. p. 329 sq.: equina, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of horses</hi> (with boum and asinorum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15698.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15698.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A purchase</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an article purchased</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex illis emptionibus nullam desidero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 15, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15698.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A purchase-deed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bill of sale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:102 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 102 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
emptito: <entryFree id="n15699" type="main" key="empti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emptĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">emt-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be in the habit of purchasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to purchase often</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not anteAug.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:10:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 19, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emptivommilitem: <entryFree id="n15700" type="gloss" key="emptivom militem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emptivom militem</orth>, <itype>mercenarium</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=77:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 77, 5</bibl> Müll. [id.].</entryFree>
emptor: <entryFree id="n15701" type="main" key="emptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emptor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">emt-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a buyer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchaser</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiator, mercator, caupo, institor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:128 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 128 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 12, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 167</bibl> et saep.; cf., on the laws affecting him, the authorities cited under emptio: pretiosus dedecorum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">who buys them dearly</hi> (=magno pretio emens), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 32</bibl>: familiae, <hi rend="ital">the imaginary purchaser of an inheritance</hi> per aes et libram, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 4</bibl> Bremi; cf. Rein's Privatr. p. 375. <cb n="EMUT" /></sense></entryFree>
emptrix: <entryFree id="n15702" type="main" key="emptrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emptrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">emtr-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>emptor</etym>, <sense id="n15702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who buys</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:63" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 54, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
empturiens: <entryFree id="n15703" type="hapax" key="emptu^ri^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emptŭrĭens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">emt-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>emo</etym>, <sense id="n15703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">desiring to buy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl> prooem. § 6.</sense></entryFree>
emptus: <entryFree id="n15704" type="main" key="emptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">emt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from emo.</entryFree>
empyicus: <entryFree id="n15705" type="greek" key="empy_i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">empȳĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mpu=i+ko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suffering from abscesses</hi> or <hi rend="ital">expectoration of blood</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
empylus: <entryFree id="n15706" type="main" key="Empylus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Empylus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, =<foreign lang="greek">*)/empulos</foreign>, <sense id="n15706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rhetorician of Rhodes</hi>, Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
empyrius: <entryFree id="n15707" type="main" key="empy^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">empyrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-rĕus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mpu/rios</foreign>, <sense id="n15707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fiery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi sublimitates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Civ. D. 10, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emugio: <entryFree id="n15708" type="main" key="e_mu_gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mūgĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bellow out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cry aloud</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 294</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emulgeo: <entryFree id="n15709" type="main" key="e_mulge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mulgĕo</orth>, no <sense id="n15709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>lsum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to milk out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15709.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguum lactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15709.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to drain out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhaust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:80:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 80, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emulsus: <entryFree id="n15710" type="main" key="e_mulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from emulgeo.</entryFree>
emunctio: <entryFree id="n15711" type="hapax" key="e_muncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmunctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>emungo</etym>, <sense id="n15711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wiping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blowing of the nose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emunctorium: <entryFree id="n15712" type="main" key="e_muncto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmunctōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pair of snuffers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">37, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emunctus: <entryFree id="n15713" type="main" key="e_munctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from emungo.</entryFree>
emundatio: <entryFree id="n15714" type="main" key="e_munda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmundātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>emundo</etym>, <sense id="n15714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cleansing</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Marc. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Bapt. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Levit. 15, 13 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
emundo: <entryFree id="n15715" type="main" key="e_mundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mundo</orth>, no <sense id="n15715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to clean out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make quite clean</hi> (a favorite word of Columella; not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:67" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 67</bibl>, where the right reading is emendat): <cit><quote lang="la">bubilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 15, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:71" default="NO">11, 2, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennas gallinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>to purify</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:23:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">segetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:7 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 7 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n15715.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cleanse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purify</hi> from sin (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">conscientiam nostram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Hebr. 9, 14</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
