emungo: <entryFree id="n15716" type="main" key="e_mungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mungo</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n15716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. sync.</hi> emunxti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 60</bibl>, followed by emunxisti), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to wipe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blow the nose.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15716.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 54</bibl></cit>; Auct. ap. Suet. Vit. Hor.—Also <hi rend="ital">mid.</hi>: ut neque spuerent neque emungerentur, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 481, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">emungeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:147" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 147</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15716.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15716.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tu ut oculos emungare ex capite per nasum tuos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that your eyes may be knocked out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 39</bibl></cit>: Aesopus naris emunctae senex, <hi rend="ital">clean-nosed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of nice discernment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 3, 14</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">emunctae naris (Lucilius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">limati quidam (Attici) et emuncti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fine</tr>, <tr>delicate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15716.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in the comic writers like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)pomu/ssein</foreign> (v. Lidd. and Scott sub h. v.), <hi rend="ital">to cheat</hi> one out of his money: <cit><quote lang="la">auro emunctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">emunxi argento senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 36, 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply, aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:60 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 60 sq.</bibl>; Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 238</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emunio: <entryFree id="n15717" type="main" key="e_mu_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mūnĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ii, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fortify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide with a wall</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n15717.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum arcis in modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non opus est arduos colles emunire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:19:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 19, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15717.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15717.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To strengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make secure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obice postes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murum opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 46, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caveam retibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sola et latera horreorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15717.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To protect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites caveis ab injuria pecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15717.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To build up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate</hi> for defence: <cit><quote lang="la">murus, ut in suspecto loco, supra ceterae modum altitudinis, emunitus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21</bibl></cit>. 7, 7: <cit><quote lang="la">locus in modum arcis emunitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 21, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15717.6" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To pile up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heap up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">toros ostro auroque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:518" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 518</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">To clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make passable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvas ac paludes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 31</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n15717.7" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">emunivit animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:17:10, p. 226" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 17, 10, p. 226</bibl></cit> Bip.</sense></entryFree>
emusco: <entryFree id="n15718" type="hapax" key="e_musco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-musco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>muscus</etym>, <sense id="n15718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clear from moss</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:41" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emussitata: <entryFree id="n15719" type="main" key="emussitata"><orth extent="full" lang="la">emussitata</orth>, v. amussito.</entryFree>
emutatio: <entryFree id="n15720" type="hapax" key="e_mu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēmūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>emuto</etym>, <sense id="n15720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alteration</hi> (with novitas), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
emuto: <entryFree id="n15721" type="main" key="e_mu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-mūto</orth>, no <sense id="n15721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alter</hi> (perh. only in the foll. passages;<pb n="645" /> <cb n="ENAR" />  cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">muto, immuto, commuto),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emutatis in perversum dicendi figuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
emys: <entryFree id="n15722" type="greek" key="e^mys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕmys</orth>, <itype>ydis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)mu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of freshwater tortoise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 4, 14, § 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
en: <entryFree id="n15723" type="main" key="e_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēn</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">h)/n, h)ni/</foreign>; acc. to R<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Lat. Part. p. 34 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Lat. Part. p. 34 sq.</bibl> compounded of obsolete interjection e and enclitic ne, as in quin, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n15723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lo! behold! see! see there!</hi> (class.; most freq. in Verg.; in Plaut. and Ter. often <hi rend="ital">em</hi>, q. v.). </sense><sense id="n15723.1" n="I" level="1"> In presenting in a lively (or indignant) manner something important or unexpected (en habet vim indignationis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> ad Ter. Phorm. 2, 3, 1</bibl>).—With <case>nom.</case> (so usually, v. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 407): ubi rorarii estis? en sunt. Ubi sunt accensi? Ecce, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=58" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 58</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">en foederum interpretes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">en crimen, en causa, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">en Varus et legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">en Priamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 461</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <case>acc.</case> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">en memoriam mortui sodalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:37:section=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 37, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">en causam cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">en habitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">en animam et mentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:531" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 531</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">pronouns</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">en ego vester Ascanius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5</bibl></cit> 672; so, <cit><quote lang="la">en ego,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 9, § 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">en hic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:65:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 65, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consul en, inquit, hic est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">em illaec sunt aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:prol. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. prol. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">en cui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">en quod,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 47</bibl></cit>.—With whole <hi rend="ital">sentences</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">en mehercule in vobis resident mores pristini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. prol. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 545</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:226" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">en ecce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 1004" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 1004</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 213, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl>, p. 243, 6.—Even en en occurs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 523" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 523</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15723.2" n="II" level="1"> In interrogations. </sense><sense id="n15723.3" n="A" level="2"> To excite the attention of the hearer: <cit><quote lang="la">en ibi tu quicquam nasci putas posse, aut coli natum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">en quid agis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:6:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 6, 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>— More freq., </sense><sense id="n15723.4" n="B" level="2"> Manifesting the speaker's wonder, anger, or excitement. </sense><sense id="n15723.5" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">quid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cur</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">en quid ago?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 534</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">en haec promissa fides est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 346</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 470</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">en quid agam?</quote> <trans><tr>why</tr>, <tr>what shall I do?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:134" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">en quo discordia cives Produxit miseros?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">en cur magister ejus possideat campi Leontini duo milia jugerum immunia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 9, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15723.6" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">umquam</hi> (or in one word, enumquam): <cit><quote lang="la">en umquam aspiciam te?</quote> <trans><tr>ever indeed?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 189</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so very freq.: en umquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">en erit umquam ille dies, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:91" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 91</bibl> et saep.; cf.: enumquam ecquando, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=76:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 76, 7</bibl> Müll.; and, enumquam, <foreign lang="greek">ei)/ pote, kai/ pote</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: en usquam, <foreign lang="greek">ou)damo/qen, ei)/pou</foreign>, ib.—</sense><sense id="n15723.7" n="III" level="1"> With imperatives, to incite to action; Engl, <hi rend="ital">Come!</hi> en me dato, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos tibi dant calamos, en accipe, Musae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">en age segnes Rumpe moras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 42</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">en age dum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:179" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:70" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:134" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 134</bibl>.—Cf. Hand, Turs. II. p. 367-373.</sense></entryFree>
enallage: <entryFree id="n15724" type="hapax" key="e^nalla^ge"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕnallăge</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)nallagh/</foreign>, <sense id="n15724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a change of words</hi> (as, vos, O Calliope, precor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 525</bibl>), Gramm.</sense></entryFree>
enargia: <entryFree id="n15725" type="greek" key="e^nargi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕnargīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)na/rgeia</foreign>, rhet. t. t., <sense id="n15725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vivid description</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> de Schem. p. 275</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 2, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
enaris: <entryFree id="n15726" type="hapax" key="e_na_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>e-naris</etym>, <sense id="n15726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without a nose</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/r)r(in</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 716</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
enarmonius: <entryFree id="n15727" type="main" key="e^narmo^nius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕnarmŏnius</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕnhar-</orth>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">-monĭ-cus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)narmo/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n15727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">enharmonic;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (sc. melodiae genus), = <foreign lang="greek">e)narmo/nion me/los</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the technical name in Greek music of a kind of melody</hi>, in which quarter-tones predominated, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 930</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">modulatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, § 942 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 4, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
enarrabilis: <entryFree id="n15728" type="main" key="e_narra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnarrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>enarro</etym>, <sense id="n15728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be related</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represented</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">explained</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not ante-Aug.): textus clipei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 625</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foeditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
enarrate: <entryFree id="n15729" type="main" key="e_narra_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnarrāte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. enarro <sense id="n15729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
enarratio: <entryFree id="n15730" type="main" key="e_narra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnarrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>enarro</etym>, <sense id="n15730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a detailed exposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpretation</hi>: ineffabilis sanctusque<cb n="ENCA" />  sermo, cujus enarratio modum hominis excedat, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:18 al" default="NO">1, 8, 18 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15730.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the reckoning</hi> in metre, <hi rend="ital">scanning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15730.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Conversation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
enarrativus: <entryFree id="n15731" type="main" key="e_narra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnarrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a detailed exposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus poëmatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 479</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
enarrator: <entryFree id="n15732" type="main" key="e_narra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnarrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an explainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expounder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpreter</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 30, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sallustii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:6:8" default="NO">18, 6, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
enarro: <entryFree id="n15733" type="main" key="e_narro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-narro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to explain in detail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to expound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpret</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnem rem modo seni, Quo pacto haberet, enarramus ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:101" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 101</bibl> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">poëmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit> Spald.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:10:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:9:4" default="NO">18, 9, 4</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnarrātĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv. comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more explicitly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1, 7</bibl></cit> (opp. breviter et subobscure); 13, 12, 5.</sense></entryFree>
enascor: <entryFree id="n15734" type="main" key="e_nascor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-nascor</orth>, -nātus, 3, <sense id="n15734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to issue forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sprout</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spring up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be born</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">in Plaut., Ter., and Cic. not at all): quod enasci colicoli vix queunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of plants,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:4:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:48" default="NO">11, 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:13" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94 al.</bibl>; also: rami enati, <hi rend="ital">shot out</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 17, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. G. Long ad h. l.: dentes ex mento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua (cervorum) cutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 128</bibl></cit>: aliquid, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 171</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gibba pone cervicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula medio alveo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:2:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:56" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:1" default="NO">41, 2, 1</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde quasi enata subito classis erupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:15:14" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 15, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestias in facie enascentes tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 28, § 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
enater: <entryFree id="n15735" type="main" key="e_na^te_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnătēr</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ina/thr</foreign>, <sense id="n15735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the husband of a deceased man's sister</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4943</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
enato: <entryFree id="n15736" type="main" key="e_na^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-năto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n15736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swim out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to escape by swimming</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n15736.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6 praef.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 21, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. p. 121, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15736.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to extricate one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get off</hi>: reliqui habere se angustius videntur; <cit><quote lang="la">enatant tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:30:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 30, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
enatus: <entryFree id="n15737" type="main" key="e_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from enascor.</entryFree>
enavatae: <entryFree id="n15738" type="main" key="e_na_va_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnāvātae</orth>, <itype>false reading for navatae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 74</bibl>.</entryFree>
enavigo: <entryFree id="n15739" type="main" key="e_na_vi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-nāvĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n15739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15739.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sail out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sail away.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15739.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ea civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:122" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9, 13</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n15739.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam e scrupulosis cotibus enavigavit oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>has escaped from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 14, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15739.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to traverse by sailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sail over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 3, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Indum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
encaenia: <entryFree id="n15740" type="greek" key="encaeni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">encaenĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)gkai/nia, ta/</foreign>, <sense id="n15740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a consecration</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dedication festival</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Joann. 84" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Joann. 84</bibl> (cf. Spald. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 33</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:35:7" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 35, 7</bibl>.—Hence,</sense></entryFree>
encaenio: <entryFree id="n15741" type="main" key="encaeni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">encaenĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n15741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to consecrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novam tunicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Joann. 84" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Joann. 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
encanthis: <entryFree id="n15742" type="main" key="encanthis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">encanthis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)gkanqi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swelling of the eyelid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
encardia: <entryFree id="n15743" type="greek" key="encardi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">encardĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)gkardi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n15743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with the figure of a heart on it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 58, § 159</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
encarpa: <entryFree id="n15744" type="greek" key="encarpa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">encarpa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/gkarpa</foreign>, an architect. ornament, <sense id="n15744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">festoons of fruit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
encathisma: <entryFree id="n15745" type="main" key="enca^thisma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">encăthisma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)gka/qisma</foreign>, <sense id="n15745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sitting bath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 69</bibl>; Sext. Plac. 9, 17.—</sense><sense id="n15745.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fomentation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:23" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
encausticus: <entryFree id="n15746" type="greek" key="encausti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">encaustĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)gkaustiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">encaustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">done in the encaustic manner.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15746.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">picturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 39, § 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15746.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">encaustica</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. ars), = <foreign lang="greek">e)gkaustikh/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">encaustic painting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encaustic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 39, § 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
encaustus: <entryFree id="n15747" type="greek" key="encaustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">encaustus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">encaut-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/gkaustos</foreign>, <sense id="n15747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">burned in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encaustic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15747.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus pingendi,</quote> <trans><tr>the encaustic mode of painting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 41, § 149</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, respecting it, O. Müller, Archäol. § 320: Phaëthon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:47:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 47, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15747.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">en-caustum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">encaut-</orth>), i., <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/gkauston</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the purple-red ink of the later Roman emperors</hi>,<cb n="ENEC" />  Cod. Th. 7, 20, 1; August. contra Faust. 3, 18; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 23, 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
encautarium: <entryFree id="n15748" type="main" key="encauta_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">encautārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n15748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the public archives</hi>, Cod. Th. 13, 10, 8.</sense></entryFree>
enceladus: <entryFree id="n15749" type="main" key="Ence^la^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Encĕlădus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)egke/lados</foreign>, <sense id="n15749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the giants upon whom Jupiter hurled Ætna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:578" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 578</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:39" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 2, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:595" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 595</bibl>; Hyg. Fab. praef.</sense></entryFree>
encheliae: <entryFree id="n15750" type="main" key="Encheliae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Encheliae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Encheleae</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Illyria</hi>, Mela, 2, 3, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 21, 25, § 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 189</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

enchorius: <entryFree id="n15752" type="greek" key="encho_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">enchōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)gxw/rios</foreign>, <sense id="n15752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of the country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">native</hi>, Philorg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 298</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avium genera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Hexaem. 5, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

encliticus: <entryFree id="n15755" type="greek" key="encli^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">enclĭtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)gklitiko/s</foreign>; <sense id="n15755.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in gram., which leans upon or throws back its accent,</quote> <trans><tr>enclitic</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 977</bibl></cit> P. al.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 272</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
encolpiae: <entryFree id="n15756" type="greek" key="encolpi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">encolpĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)gkolpi/ai a)/nemoi</foreign>, <sense id="n15756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">winds that arise in a bay</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 61, 40 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 8</bibl> written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
encomboma: <entryFree id="n15757" type="greek" key="encombo_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">encombōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)gko/mbwma</foreign>, <sense id="n15757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a white garment worn by girls</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 543, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
encomiographus: <entryFree id="n15758" type="greek" key="enco_mi^ogra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">encōmĭogrăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)gkwmio/grafos</foreign>, <sense id="n15758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the composer of a eulogy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a eulogist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">panegyrist</hi>, M. Aur. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
encomium: <entryFree id="n15759" type="main" key="enco_mi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">encōmĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)gkw/mion</foreign>, <sense id="n15759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">praise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eulogy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 33</bibl> (ex conject. Gesn. Halm, encenia).</sense></entryFree>
