encratitae: <entryFree id="n15761" type="greek" key="Encra^ti_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Encrătītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)egkrati=tai</foreign> ("the Continent"), <sense id="n15761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sect of Gnostics</hi>, Cod. Th. 16, 19, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
encrinomenos: <entryFree id="n15762" type="greek" key="Encri_no^me^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Encrīnŏmĕnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)egkrino/menos</foreign> ("the Admitted" among the Athletae), <sense id="n15762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a statue by Alcamenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
encyclios: <entryFree id="n15763" type="greek" key="ency_cli^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">encȳclĭos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)gku/klios</foreign>, <sense id="n15763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a circle</hi>: disciplina = <foreign lang="greek">e)gku/klios paidei/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the circle of arts and sciences</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the course of study which every Grecian youth went through before entering upon professional studies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6</bibl> praef.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
encymos: <entryFree id="n15764" type="greek" key="ency_mo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">encȳmŏs</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/gkumos</foreign>, <sense id="n15764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">juicy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 21, § 51</bibl> Jan.</sense></entryFree>
encytus: <entryFree id="n15765" type="greek" key="ency^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">encytus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">enchyt-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/gxutos</foreign>, <sense id="n15765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of pastry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:80" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
endo: <entryFree id="n15766" type="main" key="endo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">endo</orth>, <sense id="n15766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">praep.</hi>, v. in <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; also the words compounded with endo (indu), as, endogredior, endoperator, etc., v. under in(im-), ingredior, imperator, etc.</sense></entryFree>
endromidatus: <entryFree id="n15767" type="main" key="endro^mi^da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">endrŏmĭdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n15767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearing an</hi> endromis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
endromis: <entryFree id="n15768" type="greek" key="endro^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">endrŏmis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ndromi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coarse woollen cloak in which the heated athletae wrapped themselves after their exercises</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:126" default="NO">14, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 102</bibl>. But afterwards <hi rend="ital">a fine sort worn as an article of luxury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:246" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 246</bibl></cit> Rup.</sense></entryFree>
endymion: <entryFree id="n15769" type="main" key="Endy^mi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Endymĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)endumi/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n15769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beautiful youth of Mount Latmos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Caria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of his love for Juno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was condemned by Jupiter to perpetual sleep. While in this state Luna fell violently in love with him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:38:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 38, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Endymionis somnus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>perpetual sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15, 15</bibl> (3, 7, 15 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:83 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 83 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15769.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a beautiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beloved youth</hi> in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:318" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 318</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15769.2" n="II" level="1"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Endy-mĭōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Endymion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sopores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 6, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
enecatrix: <entryFree id="n15770" type="hapax" key="e_ne^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnĕcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>eneco</etym>, <sense id="n15770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a murderess</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
eneco: <entryFree id="n15771" type="main" key="e_ne^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-nĕco</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnĭco</orth>, <itype>cŭi</itype> (enicavit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 71</bibl>), ctum (less freq. enecatum; in the <sense id="n15771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part.</hi> enecatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:108" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 12, 34, § 108</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, enectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 9, 7, § 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:159" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 15, 90, § 159</bibl>), 1 (old form of the <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> enicasso, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 55</bibl> and 66), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to kill off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kill completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>, <pb n="646" /> <cb n="ENGO" /> <hi rend="ital">stay</hi> (freq. and class., esp. in the transf. signif.; syn.: neco, interficio, interimo, conficio, caedo, occido, concido, trucido, jugulo, obtrunco, etc.). </sense><sense id="n15771.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer ambo anguis enicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 5, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 19</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 81, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 2, 31, § 63</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cicer, ervum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to stifle in growth</tr>, <tr>to destroy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 155</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchum (i. e. vinum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 434</bibl></cit> (with exurere messes).—</sense><sense id="n15771.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to exhaust utterly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wear out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: enectus Tantalus siti, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 10</bibl> Fischer <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. fame, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 40 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos est enectus arando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15771.3" n="2" level="3"> In colloq. lang., <hi rend="ital">to torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plague to death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem amando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem jurgio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem odio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem rogitando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 4</bibl>.—Esp. freq.: <cit><quote lang="la">enicas or enicas me,</quote> <trans><tr>you kill me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 6, 16</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n15771.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea pars animi, quae voluptate alitur, nec inopia enecta nec satietate affluenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
enectus: <entryFree id="n15772" type="main" key="e_nectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from eneco.</entryFree>
enema: <entryFree id="n15773" type="greek" key="e^ne^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕnĕma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/nema</foreign>, <sense id="n15773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clyster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enema</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
energema: <entryFree id="n15774" type="greek" key="e^nerge_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕnergēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ne/rghma</foreign>, <sense id="n15774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficacy</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praesc. 30</bibl>; Carn. Christ. 34. In Prudentius written and scanned ĕnergĭma, Apoth. 468.</sense></entryFree>
energia: <entryFree id="n15775" type="greek" key="e^nergi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕnergīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ne/rgeia</foreign>, <sense id="n15775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">energy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficiency</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
energumenos: <entryFree id="n15776" type="greek" key="e^nergu_me^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕnergūmĕnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)nergou/menos</foreign>, <sense id="n15776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">possessed of the devil</hi> (pure Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">a daemone correptus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 20, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
enervatio: <entryFree id="n15777" type="hapax" key="e_nerva_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnervātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>enervo</etym>, <sense id="n15777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a state of weakness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enervation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
enervis: <entryFree id="n15778" type="main" key="e_nervis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-nervis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nervus</etym>, <sense id="n15778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nerveless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enervated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi> (rare and postAug., for enervatus; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">enervo): corpus, Petr. poët. 119, 25: homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 176" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositio (with effeminata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:142" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 142</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">orator (with solutus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et fluxum spectaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:33:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 33, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:4:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:8" default="NO">8, 8</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi> al.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">enervĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">weakly</hi>: blandus, August. cont. Faust. 22, 50.</sense></entryFree>
enervo: <entryFree id="n15779" type="main" key="e_nervo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-nervo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (scanned ĕnervans and ĕnervātum in <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 8, 64</bibl>; contra <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:143" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 2, 143</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>enervis</etym>, <sense id="n15779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take out the nerves</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sinews.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15779.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (rare and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">poplites securi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerebella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:7" default="NO">7, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">enervatus Melampus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unmanned</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 315</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15779.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to enervate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">render effeminate</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">non plane me enervavit senectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora animosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:2" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos (citharae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem compositione verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 68 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendium belli (with contundere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnervātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">unnerved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weakened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weakly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmanly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">enervati atque exsangues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 10, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophus (with mollis and languidus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio et oratio (with mollis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebrisque sententia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita (with ignava),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felicitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
enervus: <entryFree id="n15780" type="main" key="e_nervus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnervus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = enervis, <sense id="n15780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">enervated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">enerva et exossa saltatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 104, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
engibata: <entryFree id="n15781" type="greek" key="engi_ba^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">engībăta</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n15781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glass manikin made to move up and down in a vessel of water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Cartesian imp</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
engonasi: <entryFree id="n15782" type="greek" key="Engo^na^si"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Engŏnăsi</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Engŏnăsin</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">*)en go/nasi</foreign>（<foreign lang="greek">n</foreign>) (upon the knees), <sense id="n15782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Kneeler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the constellation Hercules;</hi> in pure Lat. Nixus and Ingeniculus, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 108; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 646</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:3:5" default="NO">3, 5</bibl>.—Collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">engonasis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 827</bibl>. <cb n="ENIM" /></sense></entryFree>
engonaton: <entryFree id="n15783" type="greek" key="engo^na^ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">engŏnăton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n15783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of sun-dial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
enguion: <entryFree id="n15784" type="main" key="Engu^i^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Engŭĭon</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Engyon</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)eggu/ion</foreign>, <sense id="n15784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city</hi> in the interior <hi rend="ital">of Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Gangi Vetere</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:249" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 249</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15784.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Engŭīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Enguion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43:section=193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43, § 193</bibl></cit>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Enguīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
enhaemon: <entryFree id="n15785" type="greek" key="e^nhaemon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕnhaemon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/naimon</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">fa/rmakon</foreign>), <sense id="n15785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a styptic medicine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 38, § 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
enharmonicus: <entryFree id="n15786" type="greek" key="e^nharmo^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕnharmŏnĭcus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕnharmŏnĭ-us</orth>, v. enarmonius.</entryFree>
enhydris: <entryFree id="n15787" type="greek" key="e^nhy_^dris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕnhȳ^dris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)nudri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n15787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a water-snake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 3, 8, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:82" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 7, 26, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
enhydros: <entryFree id="n15788" type="greek" key="e^nhy_^dros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕnhȳ^dros</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/nudros</foreign>, <sense id="n15788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown gem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 190</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 16, 13, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
enico: <entryFree id="n15789" type="main" key="e_ni^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēnĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. eneco.</entryFree>
enim: <entryFree id="n15790" type="main" key="e^nim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕnim</orth>, <sense id="n15790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [comp. of ĕ for pronom. stem i, and nam], a demonstrative corroborative particle. (Its position is regularly after the first word, or the first two or more closely connected words in the sentence; <cit><quote lang="la">only in the comic writers sometimes at the beginning. Put after est in the fourth place: in eo est enim illud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omnibus est enim, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 13, 37</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">al., see below. Put after quoque: id quoque enim traditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 12</bibl>; 27, 22; 30, 1; 33, 30; 36, 27; but not in Cicero, v. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:33:108, p. 325" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 33, 108, p. 325</bibl>.—Sometimes it divides an apparent compound: <cit><quote lang="la">quotus enim quisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>) </sense><sense id="n15790.1" n="I" level="1"> To corroborate a preceding assertion, like equidem, certe, vero; hence freq. connected with these particles, esp. with vero (v. under B.), <hi rend="ital">truly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be sure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in fact: Ch.</hi> Te uxor aiebat tua Me vocare. <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Ego enim vocari jussi, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I did order you to be called</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornanda est enim dignitas domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his est enim aliqua obscuritas,</quote> <trans><tr>in fact</tr>, <tr>indeed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:32:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 32, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (Dumnorix) enim revocatus resistere ac se manu defendere coepit,</quote> <trans><tr>in fact</tr>, <tr>indeed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum M. Metilius, id enim ferendum esse negat,</quote> <trans><tr>it was really not to be endured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enim istaec captio est,</quote> <trans><tr>this is clearly a trick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enim me nominat,</quote> <trans><tr>positively he mentions my name</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enim non ibis nunc vicissim, nisi scio,</quote> <trans><tr>you shall positively not go</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 60</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 2, 12</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Quid tute tecum? <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Nihil enim, <hi rend="ital">nothing truly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 24</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nihil enim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">enim nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Quid metuis? <hi rend="ital">Se.</hi> Enim ne nosmet perdiderimus uspiam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua pol refert enim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe enim hic nescio quis loquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe enim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 23</bibl>.—So too in ironical or indignant discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">tu enim repertu's Philocratem qui superes veriverbio!</quote> <trans><tr>you indeed!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his duo sibi putant concedi: neque enim quisquam repugnat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 13, 41</bibl></cit> Goer.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:12:33 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 12, 33 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 44 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non assequimur. Isti enim videlicet Attici nostri quod volunt, assequuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:288" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 84, 288</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so (with videlicet),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 9, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 6, 12</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Faxo haut tantillum dederis verborum mihi. <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Nempe enim tu, credo, me imprudentem obrepseris, <hi rend="ital">yes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I believe you are trying to take me in</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15790.2" n="B" level="2"> Strengthened by vero, and combined with it into one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕnimvēro</orth> (unlike enim, usually beginning the sentence), <hi rend="ital">yes indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yes truly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of a truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be sure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indeed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">enimvero Chremes nimis graviter cruciat adulescentulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enimvero, inquit Crassus, mirari satis non queo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 51</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postridie mane ab eo postulo, ut, etc.: ille enimvero negat,</quote> <trans><tr>and of a truth</tr>, <tr>he denies it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ille enimvero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic enimvero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enimvero iste,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—In corroborating replies (cf. certe, I. A. 2.): <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Ain vero? <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Aio enimvero,<cb n="ENIT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 188</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 2</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Eho, quaeso, an tu is es? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Is enim vero sum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 145</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Al.</hi> Tun' te abisse hodie hinc negas? <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Nego enimvero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 254</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Incommode hercle. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Immo enimvero infeliciter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 37</bibl>.—And in ironical or indignant discourse: <hi rend="ital">Da.</hi> Ubi voles, arcesse. <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Bene sane: <cit><quote lang="la">id enimvero hic nunc abest,</quote> <trans><tr>that</tr>, <tr>to be sure</tr>, <tr>is wanting here as yet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">enimvero ferendum hoc quidem non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:41" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 30</bibl>; 33, 46; 34, 58.</sense><sense id="n15790.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15790.4" n="A" level="2"> To prove or show the grounds of a preceding assertion, <hi rend="ital">for</hi>: haec sunt non nugae; <cit><quote lang="la">non enim mortualia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi vero omne tempus est ad meos libros vacuum: numquam enim sunt illi occupati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (geometricas formas) ut vidisset, exclamavisse, ut bono essent animo, videre enim se hominum vestigia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17</bibl></cit> et saep. —In parenthetical sentences: <cit><quote lang="la">quocirca (dicendum est enim saepius), cum judicaveris, diligere oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 22, 85</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpor et invideo (quid enim non omnia narrem?), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di maris et caeli (quid enim nisi vota supersunt?), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15790.5" n="2" level="3"> Sometimes the assertion, the reason for which is given, is to be mentally supplied, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 26</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 17</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Qui istuc potis est fieri, quaeso, ut dicis, jam dudum, modo? <hi rend="ital">Al.</hi> Quid enim censes? te ut deludam contra? etc., <hi rend="ital">what then do you think?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 62</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2 al" default="NO">10, 2 al.</bibl>—So the expression: quid enim dicam? commonly ellipt.: quid enim? qs. <hi rend="ital">for what can be objected to the assertion just made?</hi> quid enim de T. Tatio Sabino dicam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim? fortemne possumus dicere eundem illum Torquatum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 28, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 15, 2</bibl>; Lucc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 132</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15790.6" n="B" level="2"> To explain a preceding assertion, <hi rend="ital">for instance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">namely: Sy.</hi> Si futurum est, do tibi operam hanc. <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Quomodo? Ut enim, ubi mihi vapulandumst, tu corium sufferas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 33</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">Sc</hi> Metuo maxime. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Quid metuis? <hi rend="ital">Sc.</hi> Enim ne nos nosmet perdiderimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 19</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Lu.</hi> Di me perdant, si bibi, Si bibere potui. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Qui jam? <hi rend="ital">Lu.</hi> Quia enim obsorbui, <hi rend="ital">why because</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod enim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 228, 16</bibl></cit>: non igitur videtur nec frumentarius ille Rhodios nec hic aedium venditor celare emptores debuisse. Neque enim id est celare, quicquid reticeas; <cit><quote lang="la">sed cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquissimam sententiam, tum omnium populorum et gentium consensu comprobatam sequor. Duo sunt enim divinandi genera, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 2, 6</bibl>. See Hand, Turs. II. p. 374-409.</sense></entryFree>
